Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: Look into protein overload if your hair turns dry or brittle using protein daily
Review: I saw  this worked for some, for others it made their hair straw like or brittle.  I've had that problem myself with other products.  You can try getting products with no protein.  Look up "protein overload" and see if that fits your hair if you experience dryness or brittleness using a product with protein daily.You have to learn all the names for protein if you do need to correct your protein/moisture balance.  I'm no expert but also see if you can find a trichologist with good ratings who understands your hair type in your area if you are having bad hair problems as many of us experience (they can be a different race or have different hair than you if they do really understand your specific hair type but make sure in advance).  They can be more affordable than you'd think and they do a much more in depth microscopic look at your hair strands and scalp than a dermatologist or hair dresser.  I wish I'd known about trichologists years ago and wonder how much hair I could have saved.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: Can be crunchy, smells amazing. No-cones!
Review: I got this because I recently fried my hair bleaching it from about a level 3 (darkest brown and with a lot of silver, virgin) to a 9 within 24 hours. My hair is Curly 3B, fine but I have a lot of it. I was looking for products that would help to strengthen it again without silicones since they coat the hair and create a barrier that won't allow oils to penetrate. It's difficult to find no-cone products so after scanning bottles at Target for a long time I was surprised to find that this leave-in doesn't contain any. When I first tried it I noticed that it made my hair crunchy and stiff which I didn't like, but at the same time it felt better than it being extremely light and wispy and having no substantial weight which is what bleaching did to it. I actually added another product (manic panic hot hot pink, about 1/2 teaspoon into the travel size of the black vanilla) to it to create a cocktail and after that and some experimenting, I now really like it. I'm giving it 5 stars because even though it can feel crunchy, if I use it right I get the results I want. The way I use it now is after I shampoo and condition, I press my hair with my towel, and wrap it up for a minute or two. I then spray all my hair with this, maybe 20 sprays with the travel size. Then I add a dime sized amount of another leave-in cream, the rose one by andalou naturals and work them both through gently. The picture shows my hair this morning after that routine, carefully brushing and then sleeping on it (I don't usually brush or comb but I did to better distribute the products). You can still see my hair is fried but it's MUCH better than it was. When I combed my hair last night it felt pretty stiff. I haven't tried this yet bc I don't own a hair dryer but I plan to try this before blow-drying and I think it will provide some hold and help straighten. I think the trick to this is using it on wet or damp hair and in conjunction with other products that contain oil or provide slip. It has ingredients that attract moisture which can be good or bad depending on the climate you live in... I think with that you just have to experiment though to see how it effects your hair. For example I live in a very humid climate but I'm indoors with the AC on most of the time. My hair gets some argan and coconut oil and I sometimes spray with water and go out in the humid air so it's a mix of wet and dry factors and my own hair type and health. There are too many factors to assess without experimentation. For me though, this is a great leave-in spray and I plan to get the full size. It does smell delicious too. I used it on my son's hair (which is bleached to a 10 from a 6 and also curly3B, the photo of the pink and blue streaks) and his hair continues to smell yummy for days and days. The travel size is about $3 and I think if used sparingly on wet or damp hair it won't be too crunchy. My hair doesn't really tangle but I don't see this being a great detangling spray. I'm also including a photo of my hair straightened so you can see that this really does give even damaged hair some substance. My hair feels stronger (have been using this for about 2 weeks) and I think it will continue to improve.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review:
I bought Carol's Daughter leave-in conditioner, moisture & shine shampoo 

Carols Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Sulfate-Free Shampoo, 12 Ounce

   and hydrating conditioner 

Carols Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Hydrating Conditioner, 12 Ounce

  , all in the Black Vanilla scent. I actually bought them from Sally's Beauty Supply and am sorry I did not check Amazon first because the price is MUCH better on Amazon!I have waist-length Caucasian hair that is thick, tends to frizz in the humidity and has a natural but dumb-looking wave to it. I always blowdry my hair and usually flat-iron it too to achieve that smooth look. Unfortunately this leaves my hair VERY dry at the ends. I also exercise 6 days a week so my scalp tends to get sweaty but it's such a chore to style my hair after washing it that I only wash it 3 days a week. So I needed something that would not weigh down my crown but would super-moisturize the ends. I was using the Banana shampoo & conditioner from The Body Shop but they didn't work for me. Previously that that I loved Paul Mitchell's Lavender & Mint line, but it was just too expensive for my budget.I LOVE this stuff and I hope it is around forever & ever! The shampoo, conditioner and leave-in smell amazing! My hair was tangle-free getting out of the shower, a first for me with my long locks! The line is just so rich-feeling and it leaves my hair shiny and smooth.The leave-in is my favorite by far; I spritz it on my hair when it is about 70% air dried and then blowout my hair. Once flat-ironed, I use a silicone serum (Got 2 B) with a spritz of this Black Vanilla leave-in mixed in and Oh. My. God. Glossy hair that smells amazing and has zero frizz! After a workout I put a bit of the leave-in on my roots to freshen them up and I still can't believe it doesn't weigh my hair down.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: If you own a dog. Do not recommend!
Review: If you want piss off and repel dogs this is your product!Picked some of this up on a whim. Kinda thought it smelled alright-ish. Wasnt totally sure. Get it home sprayed it in my hair. Afterwards my dog went nuts and wouldn't even come near me all night! He was so irritable and grumpy! So not his behavior! Then it dawned on me maybe its the smell of this spray. Not really a scent I wear or go for. Went and washed it out straight away with my usual shampoo/conditioner and he went right back to normal, he even smelled my hair to double check and let out a sigh of contentment! Returning this stank crap back asap.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: Didn't work on my 3C-4A hair
Review: I really wanted to like this product, if not for anything else than to end my addiction to Miss Jessie's products.  I have multi-racial, multi-textured, shoulder length, thick hair (Spanish, Black, Caucasian) which is very curly and soft.  With Miss Jessie's products (especially her Leave-In Condish) my hair is very soft, easy to comb and very curly and glossy.I used this product on both wet and dry hair.  On dry hair it made it feel sticky at first but then after a couple hours my hair turned dry and frizzy like an afro and was completely unmanageable. My comb could not get one inch through my hair. My 'S' curls were completely gone and it was one thick bush of hair.  I also tried it on wet hair, completely wet coming out of the shower.  I often comb my hair in the shower while it's wet, so after the shower I sprayed this on and put my hair up in a bun while still soaking wet and let it air dry.  Again, no 'S' curls, just frizz.I have known about Carol's Daughter for years and I've never tried the products only because they are not sold anywhere near me, but I can't imagine I would purchase this again.  However, I will try this on damp hair and I will ask my husband (who is Puerto Rican with glossy black curls, type 3B) to try it as well.  I don't throw away items so I'm sure it'll work for someone, sadly, just not for me.  Back to Miss Jessie's Coily Pudding for me.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: Effective and aromatic
Review: My hair is long, thick and on the oily side.  After washing and while blow drying, I use a fair amount of leave-in conditioner.  I am always on the hunt for new products to try.  This conditioner from Carol's Daughter concerned me a little because it emphasizes moisturizing in the product description.  However, it actually seems less oily or creamy than some of the other products I have used that I considered satisfactory.The thing with this conditioner, is the scent.  As the name suggests, it is vanilla scented.  Personally I like it but be aware that it overwhelms the scent of shampoo, cologne, or any other products you might happen to use.  The effect lasts a good long time - not indefinitely but for a few hours anyway.As far as the efficacy of the product itself, it definitely removes the tangles in my long hair.  A little goes a fairly long way.  This is a good sized bottle so I will be using it for awhile.  Really, if the scent weren't so strong (keeping in mind that not everyone will like it), this would easily be a 5-star product.  Sometimes I might prefer not to smell like vanilla, but as long as I'm using this product, that is going to be my signature scent.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: Not for Long 4b/4c Hair
Review: This was my first time using a spray leave-in, and I was really excited because I love the conditioner, but this was awful for my hair. It made my hair slippery and crunchy which was really weird. It did not help my hair detangle and did not moisturize my hair at all. I'd recommend this product for looser curls or even straight hair. I tested this on a friend who has bone-straight hair and she loves it. It really made her hair shine and softened it up. We're in a colder climate, so maybe if you live in a warmer climate with humidity your results may be different.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: My Go-to Air Drying Product!
Review: Just for context, I have thinner wavy hair that tends to get very frizzy, not ethnically curly hair☹️Because of this, I prefer to air dry my hair instead of using heat to style and tons of products to style it. This product makes that possible for me and keeps my hair looking beautiful and voluminous. It’s the only product I use after washing as well to refresh next day hair. There is no crunchy feeling like you’d get from a mousse or hairspray, at least in my experience. It leave my hair soft, manageable, and the smell. Oh. My. Goodness. The smell is amazing! It lasts all day, and my husband always comments on how nice my hair smells.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: TOP 500 REVIEWER
Review: This is the first product I've tried by Carol's Daughter, and was looking forward to trying it since it was billed as a lighter leave-in and I have fine waves that are easily bogged down.  I didn't really that this was a spray-on product (which I usually don't like), but the pump works well on this, and it's easy to use even when your hands are slippery and wet in the shower.I'm growing out a short cut that just touches my shoulders, and a few sprays of this work well. It also really does help with the tangles.  I also like the vanilla scent, but just know that it will linger in your hair for a few hours after using it.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: Smells VERY good and leaves fine hair weightless but moisturized.
Review: I've been no-poo for almost 2 & 1/2 years now and I don't think I will ever go back to using shampoo and conditioner. But I've been in the process of letting my gray grow out for a couple of years now too. Which has left the bottom 7" or 8" of my hair pretty fried from old dye jobs. Combine that with living in a really dry climate that's been getting cold and my regular ACV and water conditioning treatment just wasn't cutting it. Worried that any commercial conditioner, even a leave-in, would weigh my hair down I was hesitant. But just looking at this product you can see it's translucent and not going to leave a greasy, heavy feeling.To my joy this not only smells divine (and I'm normally not a vanilla fan!), it has really helped my hair while leaving it light. I feel as if there's nothing in it, it's that lightweight. Even so, it managed to leave my ends feeling smoothed and shiny. I honestly didn't think it was possible!!! I love this so much I think I might switch to this long-term and quit my usual stuff for a while.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: Just wasn't for me
Review: I was very hopeful about this product because a lot of people had recommended it to me. Unfortunately, the scent was not something I could deal with so I couldn't even tell you about any results. The results other people are seeing look great but for me personally I just can't use things with scents that are this strong. It was more like and overly sweet vanilla extract scent mixed with something else I couldn't place. Again, my nose is very sensitive so it could smell and work perfectly for you so I suggest just forming your own opinion on it.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: Great for 'plopping' or letting hair air dry naturally, no silicone. does have cornstarch--can get crispy
Review: I have coarse(ish) naturally curly hair and love leave in conditioners for pre-styling use! However if you plan on flatironing or blowdrying straight don't use this. It's perfect for when I want to spray it in and let my hair dry naturally, but not for anything else. It has cornstarch in it, and that's all I can think to explain why my hair got so crispy and crunchy when I tried to flatiron.This has no silicones in it----and I liked that a lot. My normal go to is Milkshake leave in, I can do anything with that. It does have silicone in it though and some people don't care for that.I gave this to my friend with three biracial daughters and they totally love it. Her son even loved it for the smell and wanted some in his hair! I love how this gives my curls structure when 'plopping' them or just letting them air dry.  I wouldn't use it as much as my friend will so I passed it on.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: Had to cut out the tangles
Review: This product smells great but it turned my hair into a stiff sticky ball! Leave in conditioner is meant to make your hair soft not tangled and damaged! I tried brushing out the fry brittle strands and had to cut out a chunk of tangles that were knotted severely! I only had this in my hair a few hours and it made my hairs bind together in a horrific way! I have straight hair and it turned mine into a ball of tangles with a rough texture. I would not recommend this to anyone :(

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: Believe the hype! AMAZING
Review: I have 4 c hair. My hair is very curly and tough. Its always very hard for me to find a shampoo that works for my hair i have bought expensive shampoos and in expensive shampoos but nothing helped my dry and unmanageable hair. Until NOW that i used this product.I read the reviews and by doing so there was no way i could not buy it . Went natural one year ago and its been tough finding products until now . Stop your frustration and just buy this product it will not let you down.benifits:1.softens2.makes hair managable3.smells good4.better then most shampoos I've use to help with moister.Negative:1.The bottle was a bit tough to open, probably because it was a safety precaution for it being shipped im guessing.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: My favorite Carols Daughter leave in conditioner
Review: I use a LOT of this heavenly smelling leave-in conditioner. I have waist long locs that need a lot of moisture to keep them soft, pliable and touchable. This stuff is the bomb!!!  No other product compares to it and I have been using it for as long as they have been making it. It is designed to moisturize and definitely does its job. Plus, the sandalwood-like smell is noticeable but not overpowering.  I don't particularly like the cloying sweetness of vanilla, but this is much more exotic.  I am constantly having people come up to me asking what fragrance I am wearing, and I have to admit that's it is my hair conditioner.I am truly addicted to this stuff. I can't live without it.  Well, at least my hair can't 😀

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: Finally found a way to use this product with good results!
Review: I've been disappointed with this product for a long time. I originally bought it so that I could refresh my double strand twists on my natural hair because after days of wearing them they'd become dry, dull, lifeless and other products were too heavy to apply after the twists were already set in place.This product did not feel like it conditioned my hair in any way,, and in fact it was quite sticky, and I didn't even like the smell...man was I disatisfied with this!However, I'm, an avid believer in not throwing away natural products made for natural hair (especially when they are pricey) so I kept it in my cabinet for a long while when one night I had an idea...My hair was already a bit stretched out form a light blowdry and I plaited my hair (dry) into 6 sections preparing to go to bed. My hair was so dry and and I wanted to just add a light spray of water but I thought "hey why not use that watery leave-in instead" so I did. I sprayed the leave-in on my six fat plaits , lightly soaking the hair and completely soaking the ends...the result in the mornng was AMAZING!I had an AWESOME chunky braid out with defined and shiny wavy/curly hair!!! I was sooooo suprised..and the waves stayed defined for about 4 days, kid you not. And since its a watery substance the hair was light, fluffy, airy, and poofy and big but highly defined!I gave it the rating that I did because of my initial dissatisfaction and the fact that after experimenting numerous ways to use this product I've only found one great way to use it.But if you are looking to do a chunky braid out on dry braids...this is works great!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: Amazing for daily use !!
Review: Well.. the last week of August I had to go on a week long business trip. I know I codnt wash my hair in the middle of the week and straighten and style it again because it will consume time.. stumbled upon this on target and thought I will use this on my trip.. I started using it through Monday till Friday on my dry hair every morning( I washed my hair only on Sunday) and my hair never felt so amazing .. it was looking fresh till Saturday.. now that I have decided to try their conditioners and shampoo.. I honestly never write so much reviews unless the product strikes a difference in my life.. I wanted to spread the word and thought this review would be helpful to someone like me

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: Smells Great
Review: I really love the smell of this leave in conditioner, it has a musky vanilla scent.  I would use it just for the scent alone.  It is sometimes hard for me to find products that I can use that do not have an effect on my asthma.  This one did not bother me at all, but I did not spray it heavily.  Very pleased that it has no silicones, parabens, mineral oil, artificial colors, or petroleum.  It's so dry in my house now that the furnace is running, my hair was a bit dry and flyaway.  I just needed something to take away the dryness and make it easier to brush out my hair.  After spraying this on my hair, it feels soft, healthy, and has a bit of shine to it.  No sticky residue.  Very pleased

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: Leave your hair feeling very soft!
Review: I love, love, LOVE this leave in conditioner. I primarily use on wet hair (after washing it). I've found that it's easier to comb or brush my hair as a result of using this leave in conditioner. I tried it on my dry hair and I thought it was OK (my hands were a little sticky, but my hair felt fine), but I felt it worked better on wet hair vs dry hair. The conditioner smells very good and isn't heavy. I use this the entire line of black vanilla carol's daughter product, and the combination of the shampoo, conditioner, and leave in conditioner seem to work very well on my hair. My hair feels light (not weighed down) and is very soft. I can't get over how good my hair feels! If anything, this product is worth a try. I have 3c/4a type hair.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: Did Not Provide Moisture or Shine
Review: I have a love/hate relationship with Carol's Daughter products. Many are fabulous and well worth the money. Others do not perform as promised and are overpriced. The Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Leave In Conditioner is the latter. The description states that this product is for dry, dull and brittle hair, which describes my daughter's hair. However, after a month of use, all I can say is that my daughter's hair smells great. I have noticed no improvement with moisture or shine, so this is a product that we will discontinue using, and try another something else from the CD line.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: Smells good, not great for detangling.
Review: Bought this for my 1 year old who has soft, curly hair. It made her hair hard and stringy and was not a good detangler. Really didn’t like it but glad i bought the travel size. 2 stars because it smells so good.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: Not the best conditioner but smell great. I have 4c hair texture.
Review: I was hoping for water consistency similar to  a product I used to buy in the 90's called Always 911 Leave in Conditioner. This products smells really nice but it's too greasy and does not really moisturize or conditions my hair. It offers my hair oil to drink when it's thirsty for water. Does not leave hair feeling soft at all. Just great hair perfume

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: Too strong of a Smell for Me
Review: I used the Black Vanilla Moisture leave in conditioner. When you open the bottle it smells like suntan lotion. A warm coconut vanilla mix. It was very nice. But the issue I had with the product was once sprayed on my hair the smell wore on me and after a short duration of time I could no longer stand smelling myself. I had to go and wash the product out of my hair. It was simply to strong for my nose. If you are like me with a sensitive or heighten sense of smell this maybe too much.  Regarding my hair I did notice that it was not as frizzy and styled well after I was my hair. I am disappointed that I won't be able to continue to use the product to see if I notice a significant change over time.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: Did nothing for my hair...
Review: I have naturally dry, coarse hair that needs an extremely moisturizing leave-in to detangle, add softness, and tame frizz. This did none of the above, although it claimed to do it all!  I ended up spraying an incredible amount on my hair, thinking that I hadn't added enough initially because of how watery it is.  The only noticeable difference was that it added a strange texture to my hair when it dried, almost the same as a dry shampoo.  It smells wonderful, but I'm heartbroken that I spent nearly $13 on such a disappointing product!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: Very drying
Review: This stuff made my hair feel like straw. I'm going to have to do a really long deep condition to reverse this.I really love the black vanilla line of products but this is a no for me.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: Improves shine & manageability with a pleasant aloe scent.
Review: This leave in conditioner has a very pleasant aloe scent and when I used it in conjunction with other products from the same line, such as the refresher spray styling my hair was a breeze. My hair improved with the shine as well as the manageability, it was fantastic. Using this conditioner also helped me with my brittle split ends, it gave them a healthier and less dry look to them. I use this product everyday, when you spray it on it dries quickly and leaves a beautiful shine to your hair without a greasy look to it. I definitely recommend this for all hair types, especially curly to wavy thick hair. Great product.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: Can you drink this?
Review: This spray SMELLS. SO. GOOD. Oh my gosh it's like the richest vanilla scent without being cloying or fake. My fiance likes it better than my perfumes.I spritz & comb it in after a shower and it helps with detangling my 2c/3a/confused hair. I think it makes things softer? But it's very lightweight.I will buy it again just because the smell cheers me up and helps me relax before bedtime.This product made me fall in love with Carol's Daughter brand and now I'm going to try all their curl milk products.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: I LOVE this leave-in conditioner!!!
Review: This is one of the best leave-in conditioners. I absolutely love the smell. I love in a very dry climate area and have lots of split-ends, however, you would never know. I spray this into my damp hair and depending on my mood, maybe add a dry hair oil, but it's really not necessary. This leave-in leaves my hair so soft amd frizz-free, which I take as a sign that my ends have been hydrated. I started using this religiously once a hair dresser told me how important it is to hydrate your ends if you have,or want, long hair, as the oils from your scalp tend to not get distributed to your ends, and they then dry out.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: Dry
Review: This left my hair drier after I applied it on. Even worse, I applied it on after I put on Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Deep Conditioner. It still had a pleasant scent but it made my hair feel like I had gotten a protein treatment.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: Like hay
Review: Makes my hair feel like straw. Probably the worst leave in I’ve ever used. It’s kinda better on dry hair but not by much. Smells lovely, may use it as a body spray instead.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: In love ❤️
Review: I actually love this conditioner leaves my hair soft and very manageable. I always say to each it’s own due to I saw another review that said it left their hair hard and brittle it didn’t do that for me. TIP💕💕💕: if the scent is too heavy for you simply dilute it with 1/2 distilled water and I promise you the ingredients will still work the same plus you can get more for your money. Put the other half in another spritzer and you have 2 bottles for the price of one. I do this but the scent is sooo good.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: Just A Light Mist Is All You Need
Review: I sprayed this in my hair last night and did a two-strand twist. This morning I have a very defined twist out and my hair smells terrific.Reading other reviews about this leave-in being sticky, my thought was maybe they used too much. On one side of my head I used minimal amount of spray and on the other side I thoroughly misted my hair. On the side with more spray I will say that it is a bit sticky and the side where I just used a few spritzes it is not tacky at all, but still with defined curls. My suspicions were correct - so if you are going to use it, just use lightly.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: soft & shiny
Review: I've used this intermittently for about a month now. While I love that it softens the hair, and makes it shine, I have to remind myself to use this very sparingly because for those that have naturally oily hair, this product will make your hair more oily faster than without the product on. For those that share my issues I found that if I put the product on my long ends first and then work the rest to my scalp, it helps make a betterand longer lasting look. Smell is pleasantly mild. bugs don't seem to be attracted to it at least.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: Smells yummy and great for your hair
Review: I am a fan of Carols Daughter Products and this one did not disappoint.  I like the scent but it can be a little overwhelming when you initially saturate your hair.  After a while it smells really good.  It does give my hair extra moisture and I like using it for braidouts instead of just water.  It has some very nourishing ingredients that should help strengthen my hair and does not contain parabens nor silicones which I try to look for now in products.  Great for regular conditioner and everyday use.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: Great After Conditioning or Refreshing Curls
Review: Great After Conditioning or Refreshing CurlsThe Black Vanilla fragrance isn't for everyone, a little strong for me. This works well and maintains curls after conditioning,  and refreshing curls before they dry out too much. Not a substitute for a quick fix when your curls get very dry and need deep conditioning. In that case the accompanying Black Vanilla Smoothie applied to cleansed wet hair is essential to restore your dry curls to better condition. THEN this can work its magic on them.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: Makes hair feel worse, smells decent
Review: I had ordered a leave-in hair conditioner cream from a store and they were out of stock of the brand I ordered so they sent this product as a replacement.  It does not do anything it says, it smells just like vanilla which is alright.  My hair feels WORSE after using this product. More dry and damaged feeling.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: Bring your hair back to life!
Review: This is a very nice leave in conditioner that provides that added moisture and shine you need after washing your hair.It doesn't strip the hair and smells great.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: Love it
Review: I love that this leave in conditioner helps make my curls less frizzy and does not make my hair look oily.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: Works wonders!!
Review: Bought the trial size at a Rite Aide and now back to order the larger size to use on my two daughters "rats nest" prone hair! This stuff gets the knots from their hair with NO effort! I won't use anything else now!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: Almost  my Holy Grail … except for the smell
Review: Really love what this does for my 2A/3A caucasian hair. I use it after washing/towel drying and get distinct, clumpy curls that are very soft, no stickiness or crunch. I can spray it on dry hair to get decent 2nd, 3rd or even 4th day hair. It really tones down the frizz without making my hair thick and goopy the way so many leave-in conditioners and gels seem to.My only complaint is the scent, which is WAY too strong. It gets lighter as my hair dries, but never really goes away. My husband and my kids have all remarked on it (one daughter said I smell like a "weird dessert"). I will continue to use it, but I hope they'll come up with a more subtle version.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: First of all let me say this LIC smells amazing!! The smell lasts for a long time as well. It smells like expensive body spray.I sprayed a couple of mists on my braids and it gave my hair a new, fresher look with a shine. I also tried on my sons hair and it was lovely snuggling with him smelling like vanilla & other goodness.This product doesn't overly saturate your hair, but it does add some moisture. Depends on how much you spray.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: Best leave - in conditioner
Review: This is the best leave - in conditioner ever! My daughter's both had tangled, unmanageable hair. After a couple of uses of this it has become much more manageable and silky.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: Not happy
Review: I bought this bc it says it works for dry, brittle hair. My hair is fine and just that. This product does nothing but make my hair stiff and hard to comb.  Does not do what it claims or promises. I have used it twice on damp, clean hair and after drying,  it is stiff and makes my hair feel like i used hair spray. Don't recommend at all.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: 3.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I wanted something to help me in the winter with all the heat & dry air & thought this might do the trick.  While it does help keep the static/frizz down, it also weighs my hair down a lot.  It feels very heavy & doesn't add any shine.  The smell is interesting.  It reminds me of tanning oil.  Overall it's okay.  I like the way my hair feels the following day after washing it out.  It seems softer & silkier.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I love the smell of the Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla spray on conditioner. It makes my hair smell clean and sweet. I also found that this product left my hair soft and easier to comb through. I typically will use it in the morning -- I shower at night, and it just makes my hair still feel nice from the shower the night before.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: 3.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Great smelling spray conditioner but does leave hair sticky. I've got pretty dry, brittle hair, especially in the winter and, while this is actually great for styling, it's not so good for moisture because it just kind of sits on your hair. I might try an overnight mask and see if it penetrates more if I shower cap my hair, but so far, kind of unimpressed.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I like some of  Carol's Daughter hair products( I'm caucasian & have straight, color treated hair that gets dry) and was looking forward to trying this. I sprayed this on with dirty hair and did a little flat ironing after it dried and it really did add moisture and shine. I really liked the fragrance. A friend that sniffed my hair later said it was like a vanilla musk, she loved it too.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: If you need a touch up scent
Review: I loved the scent... want hair  to smell nice? Well that works. Otherwise the product dries the hair and makes it too crispy. THE Formula must be changed.,,. This is not for 4c hair

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: Two stars because of the smell.
Review: This is my first leave in conditioner and I am very disappointed. My locs have never been drier and it itches my scalp...smells nice but that is the only good thing.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: This is great smelling and it is helping to keep my winter ...
Review: This is great smelling and it is helping to keep my winter hair (dry and fly away) under control. I have fine but massive amounts of hair. Often conditioning sprays like this are too heavy, where it looks like I have greasy head rather than a conditioned head. This straddles that line but doesn't go over into the too too heavy.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: Noticed no change in hair after use
Review: Very strong smell not terrible but over whelming vanilla. I didn't notice it helping my hair in any form. I use quality products and this one didn't stand up to even a regular conditioner for being a leave in, felt dry no change for style or conditioning. Let down

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: Love This Product!!
Review: This stuff is incredible! I love the smell which lasts all day. Also, the second I spray this into my hair it goes from tangled mess to a waterfall that my hair brush glides through! My hair tends toward oiliness but it adds moisture without weighing my hair down at all and I sprayed it both at night and in the morning!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: My wife loves the smell of this conditioner (I think it is the vanilla).  I smelled her hair and it had a very nice fragrance.  She also thought that it gave her hair a shinier and fuller feel to it.I don't have that much hair to be able to tell how it works so I must go with my wife on this.  Five stars!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: Meh! 😕
Review: My wife said: I didn’t buy this from Amazon but I have it.  It did not do any good to my hair. It made my hair hard and it did not conditioned at all. Really sad because I had hopes on this product since is advertised as very natural. I have blonde medium hair.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: The scent is wonderful. I love this stuff!
Review: Love this stuff, and it's healthy for my natural curly hair. I use it more on my daughter's wavy hair. It has protein in it so I can't use it a lot because my hair is healthy. Too much protein causes the curls to flatten.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: So much better products out there
Review: Smells good, de-frizzes, and can help with 2nd day styling. But as someone with 3c hair that's VERY thick I find it does very little for my hair overall. And it's very easy to overuse and leave your hair feeling gross and sticky from all the product.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: It smells fantastic. This isn't an intense conditioner
Review: It smells fantastic.  This isn't an intense conditioner, so if that is what you are looking for then keep looking.  I have been using it for fly-aways.  I usually use a deep conditioning treatment once a week, so this is just a little something extra when I need it.  But the smell alone makes this worth every penny.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: Not for relaxed hair
Review: I have a pixie cut and my hair is relaxed. My first observation was that this product was watery. I like my leave-in conditioners to have more density because I always set my hair and never blow dry. It did not help with detangling either. My hair was left feeling dry and it lacked luster. Perhaps it might work better for someone with a different texture. The fragrance was nice, but it was the worst leave-in conditioner I've ever used.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: Smells like sun screen
Review: Admittedly, I used it once and didn't feel any difference and smelled like sun screen all day. I had a better outcome with similar products

Title: Love it!

Really happy with it and the bottle will last a very long time.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture & Shine Leave In Conditioner for Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe, Vitamin B5 and Wheat Protein, 8 fl oz
Title: Report abuse
Review: I'm certain this product works for some people, based on many positive reviews, but it did not work for my hair.This product seems like it would work for thick or coarse hair, or hair that needs a "sealant" type of product. The product isn't greasy, but the castor oil in the formula definitely coats the hair. This wasn't a positive thing for my hair type, it made it feel dry and sticky. My fine loose waves are typically slippery and manageable, this product made my hair stick together in clumps, it felt scratchy and sticky.The scent was not what I was expecting either, it has a faint vanilla scent but nothing that blew me away.I will be returning this product, it's just not for my hair type, but if you have coarse hair it might be a great moisture sealant.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Divine Strength Leave In Conditioner with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 10 fl oz
Title: Works great on my 3c/4a hair type
Review: I dont usually write reviews but this product has been amazing for me. I hadn't even finished my first bottle when I purchased another for back up. I still haven't gone through it and I feel like I want to buy more so I always have it! Please read my review if you have similar hair to me!I recently made the decision to transition from relaxed hair to natural again and this product (of course in combination with healthy lifestyle choices, good wash routine, and a few supplements) has greatly impacted the way my hair has grown (I've been using this product consistantly for about a month now):Appearance: it's less frizzy, has a lot of shine, and is growing out quickly. Less breakage and a deeper, richer color.Smell: was not my favorite at first tbh, but I have come to love it, as the product itself works very well on my hair type (3c/4a)Application: feels like a cream and when applied to damp hair, slides through like a warm oil. A little goes a long way and I'm able to work it from root to tip without too much saturation. It detangles my hair as I apply it so I dont need to do any extra combing (this is a literal miracle, I have yet to find a product that can match this detangling power)On Dry Hair: It works best on wet hair. When applied on dry hair, it didnt work as well for me, so I use a different product for refreshing (yall with the same hair are gonna know about using a few different products to achieve different looks). Same brand, the Carol's daughter almond milk leave in conditioning spray is excellent to rehydrate before my next wash day, also it smells beautiful.Overall: If you actually read all that, I'm dead serious. This stuff has been a blessing for me. If you have 3c/4a hair and you are willing, I highly recommend just giving it a shot. Wait it out, you never really know of somthing actually works until you use it consistently for at least 2 weeks! Happy hair journey!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Divine Strength Leave In Conditioner with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 10 fl oz
Title: NAUSEATING Perfume - Artificial Smell!
Review: I trusted the "NO bad ingredients" marketing of this product so well that I didn't even bother looking at them - until I opened it and got struck by the perfume smell! I thought I was going crazy.....sure enough, there's more perfume in this product than just about anything else. On that note, "94% less breakage" is a wildly false claim. Why bother when it's not true; the product doesn't do much. I hate to give such a review to any company striving for natural, vegan, ingredients - but the difference is HONESTY- and I don't see that with this brand, nor the sincere effort it takes to get there.

Title: Soft and bouncy hair
Review: I love how this product makes my hair feel so soft. Normally past products just coat my hair and by the end of the day my hair feels dry and heavy.. Not with this. My hair feels conditioned and bouncy all day. In combination with my hair growth oil blend, i have already seen less shedding and my 4a hair feels stronger.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Divine Strength Leave In Conditioner with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 10 fl oz
Title: Think I'm In Love!!
Review: My and my daughter has 4b/c hair! This leave in is bomb? Great moisturizer! Great great great smell!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Divine Strength Leave In Conditioner with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 10 fl oz
Title: 2nd Ingredient is Dimethicone??
Review: This was a super disappointing purchase! I blame myself for not looking at the ingredients prior to purchasing but when they say no this no that I wouldn’t think that the second ingredient would be  dimethicone! I put this on my daughters hair and finger comb it into her hair and it felt like I was holding a sheet of sandpaper! It clumped in her hair and in my hands..nope! I threw the bottle away in pure disgust. Don’t show me all of the positive things that the product doesn’t have and turn around and add one of the most awful silicones as #2. I love a few of the other Carol’s daughter products for my daughters hair but this isn’t one!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Divine Strength Leave In Conditioner with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 10 fl oz
Title: Worth the Money
Review: I write reviews here to help others and I must say I am very pleased with this product. I seen the difference the first time I used it. I'm 7 months postpartum and somehow my hormones left my hair extremely dry, brittle and all the bad things you can think of. I was using WOW Science coconut milk shampoo and conditioner and somehow my hair did okay but I wasn't really pleased with it. I tried this the first time and wow, unbelievable! It worked and took the extreme dryness way. I bought the shampoo, conditioner, scalp oil and this and I've been using it for 2 days and my hair looks and feels amazing. I plan to get more. I'll hate to run out of this. My hair needed this! I'm very thankful for this product. It smells good and natural to me. I hope the second batch is as good as the first batch.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Divine Strength Leave In Conditioner with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 10 fl oz
Title: My new fav leave in
Review: THIS STUFF IS MAGIC.  Now I’m not a Carols daughter fan have only ever tried 3 things from them.  But THIS !!!! Listen it turns your hair into soft defined bouncy curls and it keeps my hair nice and moisturized.  I put it on in the shower after washing out my DC and I put the shower cap back on for 15 mins then I twist my hair.  For my hair I could use this without a styler and I wear my twist for 2 weeks.  Please don’t change the formula it’s perfect.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Divine Strength Leave In Conditioner with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 10 fl oz
Title: Contains “Cones”
Review: If your hair is not a fan of “cones” you might want to stay away from this leave-in. There’s  Dimethicone and Amodimethicone and they are not at the very end of the ingredient list. They’re in the top 10.  These “cones” can coat the hair shaft and build up eventually causing breakage if you don’t use a clarifying shampoo regularly.  My mistake for not fully reading the ingredient list. Also contains drying Isopropyl Alcohol...why would anyone want to put drying alcohol on their hair or scalp? Its absorbed into the skin and can cause rashes and itching. I don’t understand that ingredient being in a leave-in hair conditioner. Glad I only paid under $10 for it. It’s already in the trash. :-(

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Divine Strength Leave In Conditioner with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 10 fl oz
Title: So bad
Review: This is the worst product I have ever put on my hair. It flakes when it is the only thing applied to my hair. I had tons of knots and it was so dry from the alcohol being so high on the ingredient list. I am 4c high porosity.

Title: Great for natural wet styling hair.

Review: Made my hair feel & look absolutely horrible! My brush would not even go thru my head with the 'stuff' in it. I tried it twice and both times miserable experience. I will NEVER buy any of these products again. Threw my money in the trash....literally.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Divine Strength Leave In Conditioner with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 10 fl oz
Title: 3C/4A-C hair, Strengthens as promised!
Review: I've been using the Goddess Strength products for over 6 months and they definitely have provided extra protection/strength to my dry prone strands, in particularly the front and top of my head.  The leave-in creme is my go to for added softness whenever I need to reset my style *and just a little every other night before bed.*  I'm not crazy about the "woodsy, after a storm" scent but it's not OVERpowering, especially since I use other styling products.  (If you're not overly sensitive to odd scents, AND I AM, you'll forget all about it after you notice the results.) I will be using the leave-in creme for life!!!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Divine Strength Leave In Conditioner with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 10 fl oz
Title: Great on my 4c Natural, hair feels soft
Review: When i started using this product i was all natural 4c with breakage prone hair. My hair LOVES this moisturizer i have to use a lot though but i did have less breakage and my hair has grown past my shoulders the longest its been since i was 16 when i had a jerri curl, many moons ago :). I can see why some don't like the scent. it is a unique, sweet scent but i love it and im sensitive to chemical type smells and smells that are too sweet. This is great and I'm buying it again. I just recently relaxed my hair but still wearing twist outs and this makes my hair super soft. Espcecially being newly relaxed on virgin hair and i didnt allow it to process totally so it made my hair a bit dry. This helps a LOT.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Divine Strength Leave In Conditioner with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 10 fl oz
Title: Best leave in conditioner
Review: I'm in love with this product, the slip is AMAZING, the texture is AMAZING everything in it is AMAZING I have a 3c  hair btw and still transitioning from heat damage :)

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Divine Strength Leave In Conditioner with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 10 fl oz
Title: HORRIBLE SMELL!!!!!!!!!
Review: HORRIBLE SMELL!!!! This was going to be my best leave in conditioner because it was thick, a great detangler and moisturizer for my hair. After one use, I couldn't get over THE HORRIBLE SMELL!!!!!! I had got a headache and it took days for the scent to finally mellow out. I decided to combat the EXTREMELY HORRIBLE SMELL by mixing it with 3 oils---Tea Tree, Argan and Shea Butter Oil---but, it was all to NO AVAIL. This product would be excellent but,I have to give it a LOW RATING FOR THE HORRIBLE SMELL!!!!!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Divine Strength Leave In Conditioner with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 10 fl oz
Title: Sticky and makes hair knotted.
Review: For mine and my daughter's hair are the only thing that this has going on for it is the smell it smells pretty good but as far as performance this is one of my least favorite hair products that I've ever used. Applying it it's sick like a body lotion which is fine if it works but the fact that it doesn't is not okay. My daughter has curled textured hair and it automatically knotted it up upon application and I've tried this more than one time I tried using it on wet hair damp hair on the ends of dry hair and it's still not her hair up to where I came and brush it we have to go spray her hair out usually leave in conditioner so it's back to normal. I have wavy frizzy curly hair and ended the same with mine when my hair dried after leaving the product and it was hard I could not run my fingers through my hair completely not satisfied with this.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Divine Strength Leave In Conditioner with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 10 fl oz
Title: Tore & dried my hair

This is the only part of my routine that I changed, it  made my hair extremely knotted .. stopped using this product and my hair stopped knotting .. also made my hair really dry .. can’t do sleek buns for a while because of the amount of fly always from the breakage.. gel doesn’t even keep it down .. avoid this product if you can..

Review: I am just so disappointed with the 4.6 review. obviously the average person has low standard because aint no way 92% of people like this product. the smell is chemically strong. smells like hazard in a bottle. you can tell just by the smell the product is not good for you. if you can't pronounce the ingredients, thats another sign that it is not good. it is not organic or natural. Google the ingredient and you will see this is not it. Stay away

My hair is back to what it was like in my 30's.I found that if I put it in my hair at night, then braid my hair,it seems to work the best for me.
