Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Divine Strength Leave In Conditioner with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 10 fl oz
Title: The scent and the softness is amazing.
Review: The scent , quality and softness of the product is amazing.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Divine Strength Leave In Conditioner with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 10 fl oz
Title: Wish I could return it
Review: If you're sensitive to smells this may be too much for you.  I started using it today and my Lord the headache I've had is a bad one.  I'm not sure if it's eligible for return but I don't trust it to not be sent right back out to someone else sans a few pumps of product so I'll likely use half the amount until it's gone.  This is the first Carol's Daughter product I've used and if the smell is this strong in all of their products, likely the last.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Divine Strength Leave In Conditioner with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 10 fl oz
Title: Working so far
Review: I like the smell and a little goes a long way. My hair has grown longer with less breakage hopefully this helps keep it healthy and strong.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Divine Strength Leave In Conditioner with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 10 fl oz
Title: Very impressed!
Review: I really like this product! My hair is fine, wavy, and bleached, so I have tons of broken ends. It leaves my hair soft and not greasy. I am pretty sure this is my first Amazon review after years of ordering things, so I'd say I'm impressed!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Divine Strength Leave In Conditioner with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 10 fl oz
Title: My Favorite
Review: This stuff works wonders for my hair! This conditioner smells fresh and crisp and is my favorite LC!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Divine Strength Leave In Conditioner with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 10 fl oz
Title: Love this product, it does wonders for my hair! ❤️❤️
Review: I love it! I am a huge fan of Carol’s Daughter products and it does wonders to my curly hair 👩🏽‍🦱 and I will be make more purchases. ❤️❤️❤️

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Divine Strength Leave In Conditioner with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 10 fl oz
Title: UNHAPPY,  Waste of Money!!
Review: This doesn't even begin to remove the little tangles from my 2b shoulder length Scottish hair, much less leave it feeling "conditioned".  I apply it liberally to my damp freshly washed hair but then have to use my trusty OGX Miracle Oil hair mask just to comb it. It's as if I'd never even applied this stuff. ?!? My hair IS NOT terribly dry and quite undamaged! I just don't get it. Experiment Failed, I won't buy this brand again.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Stinky McStinkerson
Review: I ordered this product based off of how many stars it got. However I didn’t actually read the reviews. I was looking for a cheaper version of It’s a 10 miracle spray. Upon first use I sprayed it in and it had a light almondy smell. Different but not offensive. It didn’t seem to leave hair overly greasy so I was pleased. Unfortunately, as I went on to dry my hair I noticed my hair felt more coarse And straw like than before. Complete opposite of what I need for my damaged hair. Shortly after, within the hour I started noticing a very strong perfume smell. Like strong, strong. Like my grandmothers perfume strong!!! Lucile, is that you?? Anyway, I thought maybe I was crazy so I reverted back to reviews to find I was not the only one who experienced this. I slept in it over night and I swear it’s actually stronger this morning *insert puke emoji*. My 8 year old son who doesn’t always know how to make the most tactful comments went on to tell me my hair smelled really barfy when he hugged me goodbye at school. So yeah...thats a no from me dawg.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Worse Conditioner Ever!!!
Review: UGH! Honestly terrible. I have color treated hair and was looking for a cheaper alternative to other leave ins so after reading the reviews I bought this.1. The smell is awful. Seriously Awful. This smells like the perfume your grandma used to use in the 90s.2. Made my hair MORE DRY. How is that even possible?! I don’t know. Created more tangles than if I were to use no product at all.3. I have pretty sensitive skin, including my scalp. This **** burned. Like I think I need to wash my hair again just to get this stuff out.I wish I had the same experience as others who have given good reviews but unfortunately I did not.Immediately returning.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Has been a hair care staple for as long as I can remember
Review: I love Carol's Daughters products and this leave in is a constant staple in my hair care. I usually get it at Target but I ran out and didn't feel like running out and was pleasantly surprised to find its even a bit cheaper on Amazon. I have fine, thin hair that is regularly color treated and sometimes heat styled. This is one of the products that keeps my hair healthy, despite the abuse it takes. When I wash my hair, I'll usually spray into damp hair from midlengths to ends so it doesn't weigh down my fine hair at the roots. It really nourishes my hair, keeping it soft, silky, shiny and healthy. I love the smell. At night, I mist my hair from roots to ends and leave in over night. It's a bit more expensive than other drugstore brands, but it's worth the extra money hands down

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Dry, Brittle, Frizzy Mess
Review: The leave in felt like I was applying hairspray to my hair. Instead of moisturizing my hair, it made it more dry, brittle, and unmanageable. When I tried to detangle my wet hair with this, it formed clumps of knots as if I applied a styling gel (pic included). And when I tried the leave in with my hair dry, it felt like I had just applied hair spray because it felt stiff and dry (pic included; with the orange shirt). In both pics you can also see how frizzy it made my hair. On top of that, the scent is very overpowering! It smelled like cheap, floral perfume. Not pleasant at all! I obtained a refund for this:/My hair type: dry, bleached, 2a-2c wave/curl pattern

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: No plastic wrap or opening needed, Seems used?!
Review: I am not happy with this product. It came with the cap off, leaking, no plastic around it to know if someone tampered with it or not. Amazon, this is unacceptable, I want my money back. How do I know what is truly in there with not needing to even open it? Very disappointed. The smell is very strong and I am not sure if it is the real product within the container now!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Strong smell but hair is pretty smooth
Review: It's true the scent is pretty overwhelming, maybe has alcohol -- you'll want to avoid breathing in any air you sprayed it in. When I first tried this leave in conditioner on dry (not wet/damp) hair, it made the hair feel a little more tacky rather than smooth and moisturized. But it seems to do a pretty good job if I use it on damp hair just after showering. Not tacky/sticky at all and my fingers run through my hair smoothly. The scent also fades quite a lot so you won't notice it so much all the time.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Leave In?
Review: When I first sprayed this product on my hair, I noticed the smell right away. It's not bad at all, but one can't help but notice the chemical-like smell at the end of the almond note. I used it in combination with a water and oil mixture as well as some flaxseed gel to bring out and define my curl pattern. I did this for several days straight since the leave-in states it's light enough for daily use. I live in a very dry climate, so keeping my hair moisturized is important because my hair dries out quick and feels becomes brittle. I think this leave-in conditioner dried my hair out faster!!! And I would say the butylene glycol, which is the fourth ingredient, is the culprit. It probably contributed to the chemical smell as well. It's unfortunate because finding alcohol-free hair products is comparable to searching for a unicorn. But living in a  dry climate, I really don't need another hair product drying out my hair. Luckily, I bought another leave-in conditioner in unison and it's actually containing the moisture in my hair so much better. So overall, I'd give this product three stars. It doesn't really look (or smell) all that much like a leave-in...at least compared to the ones I've used in the past...but it did help with detangling, the smell was still decent, it was light on my hair with the few days I applied it, and I like that it didn't contain a bunch of harmful ingredients.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Smells like baby powder
Review: This conditioner has an overwhelming scent, kind of like baby powder or cheap perfume. If you work in an office, it will be noticed. I have a mix of 2c to 3b curls. My hair is thick and on the fine side. The top layer gets frizzy. This conditioner weighs the waves down, does not help the curl formation/clumping AT ALL, helps with frizz minimally, doesn't control the puff look, and leaves a bit of an oily look. People probably think my hair is dirty. When it dries you don't get a softness. You get a coated look, especially on five inch long waves, or long 2c curls. I don't understand all of the good reviews unless this works on a different curl type.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Decent, Smells Like Play-doh
Review: I have mixed hair. As I'm aging, I'm getting some super wiry, kinked hairs! I picked this up because someone recommended it to me.I also have thick hair, so I have to use more than what the instructions say, but the whole bottle still has lasted over a month. It's not as effective as my usual leave-in (Garnier Fructis).This conditioner has a VERY strong, perfume-y odor. What you're going to mainly smell is the vanilla, with wheat-y undertones. Guess what Play-doh's scent is based off of? :) No, seriously--look it up! It doesn't bother me too much, though anyone sensitive to smells or who doesn't like vanilla will be put off.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: great affordable product!
Review: I was searching for a new haircare line after using IGK and not being able to keep up on the cost of their products for the time being and stumbled upon this line, I have straight-colored blonde hair and this makes my hair look amazing! I use this after I shower and towel dry my hair, it leaves my tangly hair tangle-free!!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: NOT GOOD AND GOOD ( READ)
Review: This is a great product for people who have locs or dreads. For my personal hair this product dries my hair out. It does not moisturize my hair I literally only use it for the scent, so kind of like a hair perfume if that makes sense. I try to use it one time I had just washed my hair and I applied it all over my hair , Worst decision ever. It made my hair hard unmanageable and weighed down to the max, basically everything you do not want your hair to feel like.I will only use this on dry hair and the smallest spray ever , about three sprays on my hair far away and that’s it.My boyfriend uses this for his dreads , I use it for scent lol

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: The answer to my problems!
Review: I'm a fan of Carol's Daughters product in general (I have fine wavy hair but lots of it) but hadn't tried this product before.  I've used a similar product by Bumble and Bumble as well as one by Deva Curl.  HOWEVER, THIS product is far superior to any of those more costly items.  This leaves my hair softer and silkier than any other leave-in conditioning product WITHOUT the weightiness and greasy feel of other frizz-fighting serums.  This is my new go-to super frizz fighter this summer.  BUY IT! You'll be very happy you did, just like I am.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Will make your hair dryer than before using!!!
Review: Smells great in bottle but smells like old lady perfume after drying in hair.. Product actually made my hair dryer than it has ever been should've expected since alvohol is like the 4th ingredient!! I don't know if I got a fake product since it had so many good reviews but I looked again before reviewing and suddenly there was quite a few reviews saying it stinks and is drying... BELIEVE THEM!!! only reason I have 3 star is bc I got a refund and didn't have to return and waste my time..I immediately returned the day I got it.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: I don’t know why this had bad reviews
Review: I LOVE and swear by this product! I use the almond milk whole system from Carole’s daughter (shampoo, conditioner, leave in conditioner, and hair mask). I always get complements on how my hair smells. I don’t think it smells like baby powder at all, it’s more of a subtle sweet smell. I get the best rest with it when I use it to help tame my hair in between wash days (basically use it to re wet my hair so I can do something with it), I also use it to tame fly ways and when I go natural it helps give my curls definition and makes them soooooooo smooth and soft! IM ADDICTED TO THIS STUFF! Pro tip: put it in a mister bottle for better application 😄

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: it was recommended by my friend carols daughter.  it works great.
Review: I've read mixed opinions abt whether or not leave in conditioners are actually good for my hair.  I asked my friend Carol and we were discussing the pros and cons but then her daughter came home and she sweeps the floors and answers the phone at hairousel, a local hair salon which i think is a really clever play on the word "carousel" ) ,  and she said it would be a great product so I bought some.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Improved by Mixing it with Water & Olive Oil
Review: I was a little concerned when after already purchasing three bottles all at once I read the reviews about the scent being too strong “baby powder” and the moisturizing aspect not effective to help create soft hair. But I modified the product before use which helped tremendously with the scent and hopefully with the moisturizing as well. I combined 1/3 water, 1/3 olive oil and 1/3 of the leave in conditioner in a spray bottle to use as a moisturizer in my daughter’s hair. It drastically cut the scent down to a minimum... it is a faint and manageable scent now with more notes of almond milk and less perfumery smell. This product does contain alcohol in the ingredients which I’m guessing is why others have experienced dryness from use. My daughter has 4c black hair, damaged from straightening/relaxers and we’re trying to return back to a natural style so I thought it reasonable to give this product a try. We go through leave-ins like water so the water/olive oil mixture should do well to extend the use and supplement. Too soon to tell final results which is partially why I’m rating this an average three stars (also because of the strong scent) but so far so good. I would recommend only if you are not afraid to experiment.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: The scent is overwhelming
Review: I'm not the type that writes bad reviews but I cant handle the smell of this product.I'm on the hunt for a new leave in for my daughter's curly hair. I have heard great things about this company and decided to give this product a try. Its bad. The while house smells like almonds and baby powder. Even if this was the best product in the entire world I honestly cant handle the scent.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Effective but strongly scented!
Review: This makes my thin frizzy damaged (too many years of coloring) hair feel softer and smoother. The smell is overpowering when it is first applied (almond vanilla baby powder), but once my hair is blow-dried, the smell is much less intense. I think while the product is effective in softening my hair, the scent would make it all but unusable for someone sensitive to smells or someone who wears perfume and doesn't want a competing scent.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Fantastic Detangler!
Review: Oh this product is fantastic! The fragrance is so nice and as my daughter has very thin hair that tangles like a best instantly daily, this really helps to untangle the large tangled area of her hair and makes it easy for both of us. I don’t mind helping to detangle her hair now and I find my patience is stretched a little longer as well. Will continue to purchase this product and also use in my hair.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Not great.
Review: I previously used Carol's Daughter green supreme leave-in and it was AMAZING. Unfortunately that was discontinued so I figured I'd give this a try.After 2 days, my hair felt INCREDIBLY dry. I don't have very dry hair to begin with, it is color processed and I like to use leave in conditioners to make my hair feel smooth and soft. This product literally made my hair feel like straw on the ends. I stopped using it and my hair returned to normal right away. So strange. Will definitely be throwing this product away. Also the smell of it is very overpowering, waaaay too strong of an almond scent for me. Pretty disappointed overall!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Conditions, softens and detangles our natural hair
Review: A staple on my home.  We have natural hair and use as a daily detangling, softening and conditioning spray before combing out.  Funny thing is I received a compliment from a biker 🚴‍♀️ as I was walking 🚶🏾‍♀️..... I love the smell you have on.  I could smell it from back there.  I was like okkkkkrrrrrr let’s get more.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Love This Stuff
Review: Cant find this in stores anymore. They only sale the yucky Vanilla scent. This scent is fresh and clean. I have received many compliments on my perfume, and I have had to explain to people that I am not wearing any perfume.... that its my leave in conditioner that they are smelling. Sometimes a lady have smelled my hair after I explained that, and she would say, "Yep, that's what I was smelling"Its great at detangling also, in case anyone was wondering.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Love this stuff!
Review: I really love this leave in conditioner! I think its geared towards ethnic hair,.which i dont have but i do have naturally curly frizzg dry hair and ive tried SO many different products and none work as well as this!! Its affordable and doesnt have a strong fragrance and is very moisturizing!!!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: It smells awesome and makes my hair super soft and easy to comb and manage but...
Review: I find every time I use this product I get dandruff especially if I use a generous amount. It may just be my hair, but I notice I have to be careful not to put too much. Besides that, it worked wonders for my hair. My hair is softer and easier to manage and I don't get knots anymore when I do use this product. My hair has grown fuller and longer since I first started using this a few months ago. So the pros definitely outweigh that one con.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Leave in conditioner???
Review: This stuff should be labeled as hair spray! It made my sons hair stiff. The cheap stuff for white people's hair works better on his hair than this stuff. His hair is type 3. Poor kid has to go to school like this now because it's too late to wash it out!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: If ain't broke...
Review: I'm sorry to be late with this review. Because being mixed like me you need a little help with maintenance. So, the spray is liquid gold and I normally get up first thing in the morning; spraying my whole head. Then brush and finish getting ready for the day.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Not worth it.
Review: I decided to purchase this because of all the great reviews, and looked over the ones that talked about the scent. However, I shouldn't have because the scent is WAYYYYY too strong. It honestly smells like overdone old lady perfume and baby powder. I had hoped it would just be a fresh and pleasant scent but it was not. This product also did nothing for my hair? I was hoping it would leave my hair soft and hydrated but there is literally no difference in how my hair looks. So all you buy is old lady perfume for your hair that has no hydration. Not worth the money.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Disappointed
Review: I was hoping that this product would keep my very fine hair soft and silky like it is right after washing and conditioning for between washings but it’s left it limp and lifeless. I’m so disappointed. Not sure it’s necessarily this specific product or just that no spray on conditioner will meet my expectations!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Works well but don’t expect a great scent
Review: Loved the effect but the smell is not great. Some people may like it because it would be very neutral of a scent and and not flowery or sweet smelling. My daughter and I have thick brittle hair and we both use leave in conditioner after every hair wash and after the pool. I have always used natural products and this works well without being greasy. It left her hair shiny and smooth.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: It dries and tangles up your hair
Review: I ordered this item because I researched “the best leave-in products for damaged hair” and this came up. On the instructions says apply on damped hair or dried hair. I tried this product on both ways and it’s the worst product ever! After using it my hair was super dry and tangled up ( it says it’s also a detangle)I do not recommend this product at all!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Great smell and works as a detangler for both my daughter and me!
Review: I love this product, it has a nice sturdy almond smell. While I don’t have people smelling my hair—my 5 y/o with long Caucasian hair that’s thin and wavy used this as a detangler—tells me her friends always tell her how nice her hair smells! I have bought many bottles and for now, it also seems to be avail at Walmart for about the same price—but I love/prefer ordering my staple items on amazon so I know they are there when I need them! Great product that does what it says and more!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Do Not Purchase!
Review: I use other Carol's Daughter almond milk products and love them. The Almond Milk Leave-In Conditioner is absolutely terrible. At first contact, my hair immediately began to dry and become brittle. I had to wash this leave-in conditioner out of my hair immediately to save it from breaking all over.  I threw the bottle away immediately.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Great Leave-In!
Review: I've always loved this product, but I go through it so fast, so I bought a mist spray bottle. It doubles the lasting time of the bottle and goes on much more evenly.I'm bi-racial with 3B/C hair.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: My favorite!
Review: I love this product the best one I have found and at an affordable price. You can put it on wet or dry and it really makes a difference if you have dry or curly hair. I don't even bother straightening anymore just spray it down brush it out and it stays soft and curly no more frizzy mess.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Love It..
Review: I love it, and the kids love it! Smells good, easy to apply, keeps us moisturized! Worth every penny! I’m very happy that I made this purchase and I will definitely be purchasing again thank you so much Carol’s daughter.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Works Great!
Review: I like this leave-in conditioner. The scent is a little strong when you first put it on, but, by the time you walk out the door, you don’t even notice it anymore. My hair is dry from coloring, and it’s helping improve the texture.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Ehhhhh...
Review: It isn’t the worst I’ve tried, but it’s only after I completely soak my hair does it feel like it’s kind of working.The smell is absolutely too much and reminds me of the perfume my grandmother used to wear. It lingers for the entire day and it’s just not very pleasant.I’m still on the search for a good leave in conditioner after Aveeno broke my heart, so I think I’m going to keep looking.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Love
Review: This is such a nice leave in conditioner! My hair and scalp is pretty normal so I can't speak to other conditions but I use this daily and I haven't noticed any kind of build up. It's not greasy. It's lightweight and smells amazing. This is my second bottle and I will continue to use it as long as it's available. Would highly recommend to anyone.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: The worst
Review: Absolutely the worse product I’ve ever tried on my daughter’s hair. It leaves her hair feeling extremely dry and like it’s just going to break off if I even touch it. The smell is overwhelming and honestly makes me sick. I was recommended this product for my daughters naturally curly low-normal porosity hair and I regret ever purchasing it.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Smell is overpowering, but my hair has never been softer
Review: I suffer from migraines so I can only use the product when I’m wearing my hair up away from my face, but it works incredibly. I wish the had an unscented version so I could use it for my everyday leave-in conditioner!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Intoxicating Scent
Review: I don't know if this is doing what it's supposed to do but I love the scent and the feel, but not sure if it works yet. I will update this in a month to let you know if my hair improved.  I was deeply saddened though that it arrived so days late without so much as a shoulder shrug.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: My favorite
Review: Oh my God I love this Product. It has grown my hair so much allowing me to just stylet in a bun or a ponytail. It keeps my hair soft and detangled. I started by almost everything on this product line it is truly amazing.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Don't buy if you are at all sensitive to strong scents
Review: I don't usually have strong reactions to smells/scents but this stuff made me so sick to my stomach!Immediately after applying the product, I noticed it had a weird smell but didn't think much of it. I went to sleep with it in my hair. When I woke up the next morning, I felt absolutely terrible and spent the whole day throwing up. I didn't get better until I eradicated any trace of the smell from myself, my pillow, and the bathroom. The smell turned very chemically and burned my nostrils every time I got a trace whiff of it. It didn't do anything useful for my hair either...

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Great for my locs.
Review: I purchased the  almond milk leave in conditioner for my locs and I love it.  This product does its job without making my hair feel weighed down and it doesn't leave my hair feeling like there's a thin film over it like other leave ins had my hair feeling in the past. I will gladly purchase this again.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Garbage
Review: This literally ruined my hair. I hard to deep condition my hair for a week just to get it back to normal. I saw online how highly recommended this product was for dry hair and it made mine so much worse. Other comments lead me to believe that this particular product was a knock off.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Better used on wet hair than dry
Review: I like this product. The bottle says that you can put it on wet or dry hair. I tried it on dry hair and it didn’t take very well. It made my hair frizzy and dry. When I used it on wet hair, it worked great. I believe leave in conditioner should always be used on wet hair (for natural/African American hair) .

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: If only it could smell better.
Review: Definitely helps me untangle my hair which is awesome because instead of taking 15-20 minutes to brush it it takes like 3 min seriously.  Only thing the bothers me is the smell it’s horrible omg gross kinda wishing after this bottle maybe I can find something similar with a better smell I don’t know if I’ll purchase it again solemnly for that reason only.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: works great on me and my daugter's hair
Review: As with all hair products, results vary based on hair type. It works great on my hair type and my daughters hair as well. We love the smell but unless you use the entire line with the same scent this aspect isn't as important. Carol's Daughter is great for us!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: If you are sensitive to scent don’t buy
Review: This is literally the most scented product I have ever purchased. It’s kind of sad because I like the smell initially it’s a good smell but it’s literally like dipping your entire head in perfume. It is so strong it gags me and lingers throughout the whole house. Also not very moisturizing.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Great product but smells like a baby wipe
Review: Great product, quickly detangled and doesn't leave hair heavy or greasy. Only issue is it smells like a baby wipe which is a little weird but the smell disapates fairly quickly and you get used to it.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Smells awesome!
Review: Works amazing, it is not a heavy conditioner and smells great. I have curly wavy hair and it softens well. My daughter has extremely curly coils and this is a staple for her hair routine!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: This is by far the best leave in conditioner out on the market.
Review: I love how my hair feels and smells after I use this product. It totally controls my hair frizz, gives my hair extra body and leaves my hair manageable, tangle free, and moisturized! I will definitely continue to buy Carol's Daughter products from now on, thank you for providing such high quality hair care products that does exactly what is advertised.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Overpowering fragrance...
Review: This was a good conditioner but I seldom used it because the fragrance is just wayyyyyy too strong. Not unpleasant, but incredibly potent almond oil smell. I had to give it away. I don't wash my hair everyday and keeping this fragrance in my hair was TOO much. I do have another product from CD but I would not purchase from the Almond Milk range again bc of the scent.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: This product didnot work for my hair.
Review: Usually Carols daughter products are good  but ,I was not impressed.  With this livin conditionser it was very liquidly no thickness and not much curls after I  used it. It did not work for my hair.maybe it will work  for other people hair because everyone don't have the same hair texture.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Sticky at first but overall nice
Review: I’m not sure how moisturizing it was but my hair did feel softer and it smelled very sweet and nice! When I first put it on it felt a little sticky though but after an hour or so it felt like softer hair.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Does not condition...
Review: I really wanted to love this.  But, alas, the problem is that it did absolutely nothing to condition or detangle my fine, curly hair.  Nothing.  Maybe other reviewers who had success with it had other hair types, but it did not work for me.  I returned it.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: No issues
Review: So far I like it! Don’t see a huge difference in my hair yetSmells like baby powder which I’m not a fan of lol

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Great product
Review: This is a great product. A friend stated she used it on her daughter who has thick curly hair like me and after about three uses I noticed a big difference with less frizz

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: My husband hates it too.
Review: This is the most overwhelming scent. I wasn't expecting that. I expected something like, idk, almonds or milk. What you get is grandmas perfume. And baby powder. Like a ton of baby powder. I put it in my hair wet and now that it's dry the smell hasn't faded at all. Apple cider vinegar rinses leave less of a scent and more softness than this. I'm disappointed to say the least. My hair looks and feels nice but my head is pounding, I'll have to wash it out.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Meh!
Review: I prefer the Black Vanilla Leave-in. It smells better. I wear microloc's and I apply a water-based leave in to help moisturize my loc's and to make them smell good.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Makes my hair stiff
Review: The smell is wonderful, but t makes my hair stiff and therefore MORE frizzy looking because the baby hairs stick out straight and stiff from the rest of my hair. I have very long hair and I can barely get a brush through it after using. Now, my Son is 2 and this is great to spritz on his curls to freshen his boy smell between washing. So, not great for me as a conditioner.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Leaves hair dry & too perfumed.
Review: I have never wrote a bad amazon review...but i am for this one!ladies-- you're better off with some cheap drugstore product than this! this product left my hair feeling like straw! did the exact opposite as what it was supposed to! and on top of all this, it's way too perfumed (and I can handle perfume)..I could barely sleep at night without having to wash my hair, afraid it was gonna give me some kind of scent headache. This stuff is as bad as ocean salt water. Don't do it.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Decent product
Review: Some of the previous reviews mention the scent. It is strong at first but gradually fades. I actually like the smell so I don't mind it. I love that this product has no parabens and less chemicals than other leave in conditioner sprays. But my hair doesn't feel as soft, but I'm happy as it still does it's job pretty well.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Amazing product!
Review: I love this product not only because its from my hometown and has a beautiful story behind it, but because the product works! The scent is amazing and it leaves my hair feeling soft and manageable only after one day of use!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Satisfied consumer🕊🌹🕊
Review: This is the second time that I've purchased this product which speaks volumes regarding my satisfaction! I will continue to use foreffectiveness in moisturizing and softening my hair. I also love is gentle scent of freshness. It's not "overwhelming or brash" 🕊🌹🕊

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Awesome
Review: This product did leave my daughter hair soft and easy to comb. Great buy .

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Light moisture, nonhumectant
Review: Less effective than other brands specifically designed for coarse/curly hair. Is a light moisturizer, nonflaking and not sticky with no humidity resistance.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: A favorite
Review: Love this product.  It makes my tangled wet hair easier to comb through, smells divine and leaves my hair super softbb

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Good conditioning, but strong smell
Review: This spray is very light and made my hair instantly softer and less frizzy. Didn't notice any residues after putting it in, just lighter and softer hair. I was surprised by the scent–it smells strongly of baby powder. Not sure if I will purchase again because of this. It works well otherwise and the price is great but if you plan on going out people will definitely smell it.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: After use this product is not flakey.
Review: I like the product because after application, it dries quickly with no residue.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Smells like baby powder
Review: I haven't use it much because my boyfriend and I thought it made my hair smell like baby powder. Even if the product works, I really don't want to smell like baby powder.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: not so much
Review: If you're like me and have super thick hair that tangles easily, this won't be the product for you! And I'm sad about it too because it smells so heavenly. It just doesn't make my hair soft or get the tangles out very well. would probably be great for someone who doesn't have stupid hair like mine that tangles all the time!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Must try!
Review: This is one of my favorite leave-in conditioners, it smells nice, it doesn’t leave my hair heavy, stiff, or sticky. I’ve had trouble finding it in the stores lately, so pleased to find it here.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Unpleasant Scent
Review: I thought this product had a terrible smell. I was hoping it would dissipate after drying in my little one’s hair, but it didn’t.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: If you want dry hair buy this product. If you want soft hair, don’t
Review: This product made my hair feel even more dry and the scent smells like very cheap perfume. Gave two stars instead of just one because the return process was quick and easy and I didn’t have to actually return the item to get my money back.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Inconsistent color but seems to work fine.
Review: I've been using this product for about a year and a half. The first few bottles were a dark brown color and the most recent bottle is a light cream color. Not sure which it's supposed to be but the inconsistency concerns me. Has been working well so far, no tangles and hair seems healthy. Just a couple sprays each day after shower.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: I have fine, wavy (and frizzy) hair
Review: Bought as a detangler and daily leave-in but was left with crunchy, harder to manage hair. I have fine, wavy (and frizzy) hair, and I’m sorry to say the product did the opposite of expected. Smells nice though, and product was refunded without issues.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: While I am generally not picky about conditioners, using inexpensive brands or what is on sale, etc. I have to say, this is really nice.  The ingredient list is a little different than most, in a good way.  While it contains the usual mix of chemical compounds, it starts with aloe, followed not too far down the list by shea butter.Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Ascorbyl Palmitate, Butylene Glycol, Butyrospermum Parkii (Shea Butter), Calendula Officinalis Extract, Carbomer, Cocos Nucifera (Coconut) Oil, Cymbopogon Schoenanthus Extract, Dimethicone PEG-8 Meadowfoamate, Disodium EDTA, Glycerin, Helianthus Annuus (Sunflower) Seed Extract, Hydrolyzed Vegetable Protein PG-Propyl Silanetriol, Hydrolyzed Wheat Protein/PVP, Crosspolymer, Lactic Acid, Laureth-23, Laureth-4, Panthenol, PEG-40 Hydrogenated Castor Oil, PEG-75 Meadowfoam Oil, Polyquaternium-11, Polyquaternium-7, Polysorbate 20, Potassium Sorbate, PPG-26-Buteth-26, Prunus Amygdalus Dulcis Seed Extract, Prunus Armeniaca (Apricot) Kernel Extract, Prunus Amygdalus Dulcis (Sweet Almond) Oil, Retinyl Palmitate, Silicone Quaternium-3, Sodium Hydroxide, Sodium Benzoate, Tocopheryl Acetate, Trideceth-12, Trimethylsilylamodimethicone, Vitis Vinifera (Grape) Seed Oil, Fragrance (Parfum).The conditioner has a delicate scent, and goes into the hair nicely.  You do not need to use a lot.  It does not make hair look greasy when applied either.  If anything, it  made my hair and my wife's look a little dryer the first time or of use. I suppose that is a detractor, depending on your hair type.  If your hair is fine and/or oily, like mine, you probably will like this conditioner more so than other hair types.  After a use or two, it added a gentle sheen to my hair.  After a few uses, my hair showed more "life.  My wife, who has medium fine hair, but more dry than mine, likes the conditioner as well, and I can see the added bounce and shine on her tresses.I even put a small dab on my arms and hands and rub it in.  It has a nice, smoothing, moisturizing effect.I know many reviews mention a strong scent.  The bottle I have is not strong at all - in fact it is a faint scent.Overall, I really like this conditioner.  Again, I am not a huge fan of conditioners, but this one does seem to add bounce and sheen to hair.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: The Carol and Daughter Almond Milk Leave in Conditioner worked very effectively on my past shoulder length, dry, Asian hair.  Because my hair is so porous, some leave in conditioners leave my hair heavy feeling and oily.  This conditioner worked fantastically at conditioning my hair without making it heavy, oily looking, or frizzy.  The conditioner absorbed very well into my hair and left my hair feeling so soft and manageable.  I sprayed on the conditioner while my hair was wet and blow dried it with great results.  My hair looked healthy and shiny without looking overly glossy, and I couldn't stop playing with my hair throughout the day - it felt so soft!While I like the leave in conditioner because of the softening effect it had on my hair, I can't say that I'm in love with the sheer strength of the scent of this product.  The scent of this leave in conditioner is pleasant, but is really strong!  Even after my hair was dry, throughout the day I would get a whiff of the almond baby powderesque scent when I'd turn my head.  Now, if I could smell the conditioner, I'm fairly sure that other people could easily smell me from afar.  When first applied on wet hair, the scent was even stronger.  It wasn't so overbearing that I felt like I sprayed myself in the face with perfume, but it was still not pleasant to smell while my hair was wet.  The lingering scent was not a dealbreaker for me as I didn't mind getting a soft whiff of almonds every now and then throughout the day, but I'm quite sure not everyone will be thrilled to have a lingering scent clinging to them all day.  If you don't enjoy strong scents, this product is NOT for you.Overall, this Leave in Conditioner worked very well for my hair.  It made my hair soft, manageable, and very smooth without weighing it down, but the scent was a bit overbearing, particularly when my hair was wet.  If this was made in a lighter scent, this Leave in Conditioner would be 5 stars...unfortunately, the smell is just too much of a good thing.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: 3.0 out of 5 stars
Review: It's a nice conditioner that you don't have to wash out, but you may want to wash out anyway.  Here's why:  although it leaves your hair nice and soft, you will be leaving a trail of scent behind yourself for hours after application.And I say that as someone with almost no sense of smell.  I could smell this conditioner for hours after application.  It wasn't and unpleasant aroma, but other people may not have liked it as much as I did.  So I felt kind of self-conscious walking around with this aroma wafting after me.  After all we live in a world where many people are allergic to, or intolerant of, scent.  So, this should be tried with caution.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: 2.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I'm giving this item 2 stars to be fairL my daughter has used it and seemed to think it was ok--nothing miraculous or anything like that as far as its conditioning properties. I have dry, thick wavy hair (not processed in anyway, I'm just getting older) that I do blow dry. Plus I live in Alabama where the weather is hot and humid. I found that this had the opposite effect from what is promised: my hair was dryer, and much more "webby" (sort of how my hair gets in the worst humidity, tangly, and difficult to manage) than usual with this. It certainly didn't feel soft, but felt sticky! The smell is initially pleasant, but having it on my hair all day, it became cloying and annoying. And when I washed my hair the next morning, the smell lingered for another 24 hours or so.Perhaps this works for some hair, but it does nothing positive for me.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: this leave in conditioner is easy to use. sprayed on damp hair, it is an effective detangler. sprayed on both dry and damp hair, it does provide some softness and moisture to dry, over processed hair. My hair is fine and color treated and is frequently subjected to heat from dryers and curling irons. This did leave it feeling soft and looking healthy. However it didn't do much to refresh my style and the fragrance is strong. It is not an unpleasant aroma, sweet like baby powder and light musk, but not my favorite. It is strong and it lasts all day. The bottle tucks easily into a bag or briefcase and the spray functions smoothly. I wish it either had a difference scent or was fragrance free. I appreciate the exclusion of mineral oil, petrolaltum or artificial coloring. It is an effective product that provides relief to stressed locks.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Curly Hair
Review: I think this conditioner works well with curly hair! Granted, I still did my regular post washed hair routine, however the softness and stability of my hair is definitely great! It took care of most of my frizziness - something I have only seen with the Aveda Curl Shampoo and Conditioner set.Make sure to continue to do the pre (oiled hair for a couple hours) and post wash (Moroccan oil curl enhancer) routine for your curly hair and this conditioner will definitely enhance and defrizz curly hair.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: I really hope the company sees this review
Review: I think they switched the formula. I used carols daughters early last year in 2020 and it was amazing and it smelled nice. However, I had to stop buying their products bc of the strong chemical-like smell that's being masked by overwhelming perfume.I was so disappointed because I bought a whole bottle and was in the middle of doing my hair and I could not bring myself to even use it for the sake of my wash day routine.... I believe the other reviews when they say it smells bad.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Hm..
Review: I'm not sure why there are so many bad reviews, but then I don't know much about hair products. I usually don't leave reviews but felt it was worth it because I am 30 years old and this is the first hair product of which I have ever finished the entire bottle (besides basic shampoo and conditioner of which I just get whatever is on sale). Not only that, but I can't find it in-store so I came here to order more. I never noticed a problem with the scent and it doesn't seem strong to me. My hair tangles immediately so I have to slather it in spray on conditioner while wet or regular conditioner in the shower and spend forever brushing it out. If I don't do so it takes 5x as long and hurts (I am aware you're not supposed to brush your hair out wet, but the potential damage is well worth it to me). This has been the best product I've ever used for doing so. I let my hair air dry and never put anything else on it, and this makes my hair dry and look better than after using any other product to air dry it.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Good product overall, but the scent for me is associated with a diaper change, and it's not a pleasant scent :-(
Review: I really want to like this product, because I like the company and it's mission and quality.  However, the fragrance of this product makes it impossible for me to want to use.  I've tried it about three times now, and it's very light and offers some nice texture.  But the fragrance is some sort of baby powder... now if you have not had children, this may be a pleasant smell for you, but for me, the association of this scent is that of diaper change/diaper pail.  I used it a few times to see if I would drop the association and it wouldn't bother me, but it didn't go away I am sorry to say.  Ironically, it is probably the natural sensibility of the ingredients that makes the association so strong.  If they were to make this product with another scent, I would definitely give it a try.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: My granddaughter has extremely curly hair. It's at least a 3B, with some sections more like 3C. It takes her a long time to comb through it before and after her shower. I try to keep a supply of hair products on hand for when she spends weekends with me. Most of the products I buy don't do much for her hair. We were anxious to see how well Carols Daughter would work. We both like the scent of the leave-in conditioner, it's a strong almond scent. The bottle sprays well without clogging. While this spray didn't work miracles, it did make it easier to get the comb through. Her hair also feels softer with it. It's much better than most of the leave-in conditioners we've tried. This is something we would buy when this bottle runs out.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Wife's review- I have thin, fine, color-treated (damaged), wavy hair that I straighten. My daughter has fine, thin, super curly hair. We live in the humid south, & frizz is a constant issue. I put this in my hair after washing while it's still wet & then dry it. It seems to help protect from heat damage & keeps the frizz down. I spray it in my daughter's hair dry just so I can get a brush through the tangles. Once it dries, you can't tell there's product in her hair and the curls form perfect ringlets. It smells nice, too. I have never tried Carol's Daughter brand before, but I'll be buying this again. Other reviewers mentioned that it made their hair brittle & dry- My experience has been the opposite.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: 1.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I originally thought this was a decent leave in after the first few uses, but quickly found that it stared to dry out my hair the more I used it. There seems to be a lot of protein ingredients in it, along with Shea butter, which is just an altogether bad combo for my fine, color treated hair. I wouldn’t suggest using this unless you have already moisturized hair, and know your hair responds well to protein. It smells nice, but ultimately wreaked havoc on my hair even just from a single week of use. I wish I hadn’t bothered with it, and spent my money on something else.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I am such a huge fan of this scent.  Even my husband loves the scent of my hair when I use this.  I am brunette, my hair is not color treated and is naturally quite shiny.  I have very fine hair but I have lots of it.  Aside from the scent, I don't realize notice much of a difference in my hair's performance when I use this.  My hair is slightly wavy & it wear it in numerous styles---natural, blown out, texturized, straightened with a flat iron, curled, you name it and no matter what style I choose I just don't notice much of a difference here. But that smell....I can't say I won't buy this again for the scent alone.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Pleasant to smell, effective leave-in conditioner spray. My hair, personally, tends toward oily rather than dry, but as the 'designated brusher' of a teenage girl's hair before events where she needs to be 'presentable' (or when she's lazy or just in the mood to have someone else do the work), I can attest to how much easier it is to work with hair once it's been so conditioned. Occasionally a detangler is required if it's a right squirrel nest to start with, but usually that is not the case. In my sort of low-intensity\low-need hair care requirement\experience, this is deemed a good product, and I fully endorse its use.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Almond Milk Leave-In Conditioner - very nice fragrance
Review: This conditioner has a nice light pleasant scent  It is not the best detangler I've ever used but far from the worst (and I've tried every one I can get my hands on).  My only quibble, and it is completely personal, is that it's a bit heavy for my particular hair (on the oily side).  In all fairness, this product is intended for over-processed, extremely damaged hair.  Like I said, I try them all.  I am in my 60s, long thick hair (thought not nearly as thick as it once was), never been dyed, in pretty good condition overall - so I'm not the target market.  I do love the scent though.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review:
Your hair will thank you if you pair this leave-in conditioner with 

Carols Daughter Almond Milk Ultra-Nourishing Hair Mask

  . Dry, natural hair needs lots of nourishment, and this double dose will add both luster and softness to your hair. The pump-action spray leaves a mild, sweet scent without a flaky residue. Spray it on, 

pick

   it out, and look and smell awesome all day.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: This is a little too heavy for me for daily use, but perfect for weekly/monthly deep conditioning. Leaves hair feeling incredibly soft and smooth in a way that seems to last, long after use -- even after additional washings. Just spray on wet hair, comb through and let dry.This is made for processed, damaged hair and is especially emollient. It also smells really nice, without being overpowering.My sister-in-law, who has very thick hair that tends to be dry, swears by Carol's Daughter products.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I was happily surprised at how well this leave in conditioner worked on my straight hair. My hair is color processed, but fairly healthy. I do get some hair that looks a little dry on the ends. I put a little of this on dry hair and it immediately smoothed the hair and make it look great. I took off one star because the scent is strong. I like baby powder scent, so that doesn't bother me. But this scent lingers a long time and is a little too strong. If the scent could be more subtle, then this is a 5 star product.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I have been using this leave-in conditioner every day in place of my regular conditioner. I have oily hair that has some damage and is fine. I use conditioner every day. I will admit that I was a little concerned that this product would make my hair oily. It does not at all!The product is easy to use. All you do is hold it about 6 inches from your head and spray. Then, you are good to go. It definitely saves me a few minutes in the morning since I do not have to lather it into my hair and then wait and then rinse it out like regular conditioner. The only downside to this product is that the scent is quite strong. It smells like a strong perfume. I don't love it, but most of the smell fades quickly. It may be tough for people with allergies. The leave-in conditioner does make my hair easy to brush and incredibly soft. I think it helps to improve the little bit of damage that my hair has also.Overall, I really like this product. It makes my hair feel and look great. It doesn't smell the best, but isn't too bad once it fades some. I would recommend giving it a try.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Seems counter intuitive at first, but works well.
Review: Without asking, my spouse commented that they really liked this product.  It works great according to my wife and daughter who both tried the product.  They say that while it seems a bit strange leaving conditioner in, it leaves their hair more manageable without being greasy. The product applies easily and the directions are clear and easy to follow.  It is a product that both are happy with and will buy again.  That is about the best recommendation one could ask for.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Awful!!!
Review: worst product ever !!!!! tangled up my hair, made my hair very limp when my hair is thick and luscious just by using shampoo + conditioner . worst !!!!i have luxe, silky smooth asian hair btw

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Personally- way too much hype for a product that does nothing
Review: Honestly this is one of the only amazon reviews I’ve given. After searching for hours for the right leave in conditioner to buy after my last one was discontinued I was super excited to try this. I have been using this for about a week now to truly test it out and honestly... if I could rewind a week ago I would. It REEKS of baby powder, and does nothing for my hair. It may even make my hair harder to comb through to be honest, and makes it more brittle/straw-like once dry. Really wanted to love this product- but it was honestly a waste of money.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: False advertising -- it does contain silicones
Review: I was disappointed to find that this product -- advertised as containing no silicones -- contains dimethicone and silicone. The packaging and description lie. How is this not fraud?

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Contains DIMETHICONE (SILICONE),
Review: Carol's Daughter Almond Milk Leave-In Conditioner contains DIMETHICONE (SILICONE). Dimethicone turns my hair brittle and into straw , similar to what happened to other reviewers of this product. Black Vanilla Leave-In Conditioner works better on my hair (3C-4A curl pattern).

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This leave-in conditioner smells wonderful. For those of us who don't have a large amount of time to spend fussing over our hair, this product is perfect. There's no need to wait five minutes in the shower or the tub before rinsing it out. I just leave it in, and my hair is easier to arrange. It leaves my fine-textured hair feeling thicker with more body.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Great for my fine textured hair
Review: I bought this at my local CVS.  My hair is fine and naturally wavy, and very prone to frizz.  This did not work great letting my hair air dry, but it works fabulously as a leave-in, thermal protecting product when I blow dry my hair.  I'm very happy with it and am curious to try other Carol's Daughter products.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Since my is super frizzy and curly and dry, I had high hopes for this product. Here's how it affected my hair:Detangling: worked great! No more tangles!De-frizzing: eh.. Imperceptible improvement. If I don't use any other products, i'm a fuzzball.Scent: mmmm.... Very nice baby powdery scent. I can even smell it in my hair hours later.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Hair conditioner that works miracles for those with fine hair
Review: My wife tried out this product and the following comments are from her assessment of using it:1:  Leaves a nice pleasant clean smell in your hair.2:  Tames wife's unruly hair for manageable control of her hair style.3:  Gave some body to her very fine hair.4:  All in all, a very good product!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Favorite Leave-in Conditioner
Review: The very best I've used.. The smell is so amazing and my hair is so soft. Won't use anything else.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: this is a light weight conditioner that really smells nice kinda of fruity to me.  I like it cause i have long hair and this allows me brush my hair without a ton of tangles. Great if you are like me and have a tangle problem. Does not make my hair feel or look greasy. Over all like it

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Good product and can immediately feel a different texture on my hair after use. Smooth, soft and no frizz. However it has a strong scent, can't tell what it is. I'm fine with the scent but it is strong, some people would not tolerate it.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Likeable
Review: LikeableThis is best for me when I plan on using heat to smooth my curly hair rather than when wearing it natural. Smells nice smooths my hair and  it doesn't feel dried and fried.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Dried out my hair
Review: I love the smell but it didn't work as I expected.  I thought it might make my hair greasy, it did not.  Instead, it actually made my hair feel dry and almost like straw.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Excellent product
Review: This product is amazing it smells great and works.  My hair doesn't have a chemical and can be hard to comb and manage after washing. But this definitely did the trick all the way.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Smells fresh
Review: This was a nice pick me up for my hair throughout the day, left it smelling fresh and feeling soft. After using this an the conditioner I feel like my hair is much healthier

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Great!
Review: I really like this scent of the leave in conditioner.Smells wonderful and I like what it does to my hair.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Leave In Conditioner with Almond Milk, Aloe Butter and Shea Oil for Extremely Damaged Hair, 8 fl oz
Title: Well it did make my hair fall out at least!
Review: This stuff makes my hair feel worse then it did before I put it on . It looks dull and feels straw and makes it very hard to brush . The only reason I gave it one star is because it at least didn’t make my hair fall out .
