Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: 3.0 out of 5 stars
Review: The design and packaging of the spray bottle looks promising. Ingredients and instructions are clearing stated for its purpose which is repairing our hairs. It did that, but not a full pleasant process in my experience.I am not a stranger to leave-in hair treatments or conditioners.  I have used a few brands in the market in the past 5 years because my hairs are naturally thin and dry. I need leave-in conditioner to protect my hairs under the brutal sun and this product achieved that. I tried it for 2 days and it kept my hairs moist and shine under the sun and my hairs could be combed and styled easily after my sleep without shampooing and hairdryer. That preserve the natural oil for my scalp and no unnecessary heat torture for my hairs in the morning. It also saved me time and money.  My hairs look healthier due to the added shiny layer and they also seem to be more straight than usual and I am happy with that.However, the scent from this leave-in conditioner is a little funky. I guess it is a either you love it or hate it thing. I was pleasant in the beginning, but it lingered all day and it made me feel annoyed by it. Also, my coworkers in office could pick up the scent near by easily and they kept asking what was that smell. It doesn’t stink or anything, but it doesn’t make me feel comfortable that people know that it is on my hairs. I am still using it, but I will only use it on stay home weekends and staycations.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: I had really high hopes for this product. I typically use a professional quality leave-in conditioner, but I have used more affordable leave-in conditioners in the past so I can make a fair comparison. This product feels like it should cost half the asking price of $19.The first thing that stands out about this product is the awful smell. It's horrible. I use this on wet hair and the smell stays noticeable until my hair dries. Once dry, I don't notice the scent anymore. Once you get over the smell, the product just doesn't stand up to the claims that it makes. It states that it will detangle hair, and add shine, softness, and manageability. It doesn't detangle at all. It does add shine, but it's greasy and if you touch your hair, the product comes off on your hands even after hours. As far as adding manageability to my hair, it seemed to hold heat styling for longer with this product, but I had to clean my straightener and curling iron after using them when I had this product on my hair.Overall, I wouldn't recommend this. It doesn't detangle, it adds grease and weight to hair, and it makes your styling tools filthy.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: 3.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I generally like this brand, but this was a bit of a miss for me. It smells great, but it did little in the way of moisturizing my thick-but-fine, tangle-prone, dry blonde hair. I tried it after my shower with nothing else; it didn't help me get through the tangles at all, and my hair air-dried a bit frizzy and dry looking. I tried it before my usual styling product, and the results were no different than if I had just used my stuff alone. I did find that it works well as a shine spray, or as an extra dose of moisture, on dry hair. It doesn't make a lot of difference, but it does impart a nice scent, makes my hair look shinier, and makes it feel slicker (and less tangle prone), at least for a couple of hours (I was back to tangles by day's end).For some reason it seems like this product doesn't penetrate my hair properly; it seems to just sit on it until it dries up. That makes it a nice finishing product, but not a good leave-in (at all) for me.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This is a very nice leave in conditioner. It can be applied to wet hair as a detangler or to dry hair to refresh your hair. I usually use it after I showered and I have to admit, this made my hair feel amazing. I brushed right through it without a tangle in sight! It also has a very pleasant scent that I just can't identify what it smells like, so it must be that monoi oil since I am not sure what that would smell like, but I REALLY like it a lot. The smell lingers for a bit and I wouldn't mind smelling it for a lot longer than it did.Once my hair was dry it looked beautiful. It was nice and shiny, did not look greasy, heavy or limp. I was very happy with how it looked and felt, very nice and soft just the way I like it. You don't need a lot of it either which is great since it isn't the cheapest, but also not the most expensive product I own.Fantastic product that I am very happy I found and will be repeat purchasing!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: For years I have bleached my hair and because of this I have very damaged and dry split ends. I have to apply a leave in conditioner every time I take a shower because if I don't I can't even run my brush through my hair. This is a decent leave in hair conditioner that untangles my hair and helps it feel more soft and manageable. It gives my hair a little shine and what I love most about it is the smell it leaves behind, even after my hair has dried.I have used many leave in hair conditioners over the years and find this one to be pretty good.  This isn't as effective as some of the higher priced brands but his fair for the price. I do notice that this leaves my hair feeling like a bit of residue is Left Behind when I use it though so make sure to only use a little bit.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: Smells amazing!!
Review: I have used the monoi shampoo and conditioner from Carol's daughter for over 6 years and it makes my fine long straight hair feel so smooth and shiny. The smell is absolutely stunning, coconut and Jasmine flowers. I was so excited to get a chance to try this. It is a unique product, a cross between detangler, leave in treatment, and hair oil. It smells exactly like the shampoo and conditioner. I use it every morning to style my hair without the greasy buildup. The sprayer makes it easy to use, and if you don't do much with your hair other than brush it out and put it up, this is a Time saver since it smoothes your hair and makes your hair look more sleek and put together by sleeking and smoothing flyaways. I'll be using this to the last drop. Will definitely be getting more in the future.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: Wifey has had some difficulties with her hair of late and has been trying different things to help. Here is her experience with this conditioner:Sometimes being on different medications it will affect and damage your hair by weakening it and making it brittle. After a long barrage of them, this had happened to me. So I was hoping that using Carol’s Daughter Monoi Leave-in Conditioner would help. I know that nothing is a 100 percent cure but it did help make it softer and shinier. I like that you could use it on your hair whether it is wet or dry, I will say that I was concerned when I first sprayed it on dry hair it did have a greasy look until it dried and was very soft. I will continue to use the product long enough to verify whether there is an improvement or not.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: don’t know what in this set off a sneezing frenzy but, something in it does within a minute and it does not matter if i spray it on (which i though why i kept sneezing the first time) nor matter if i spray in into my hand and put it into my hair that way, i end up sneezing away.. The fragrant may just be the culprit, it is 4th in ingredients and super perfume-y (fragrant is also listed again towards end as well).. It did make the frizzy tamed down without needing a lot and gave my hair (caucasian hair) a smooth shiny look so if strong fragrant product isn’t an issue for you, you may like this.Not recommend for those that get sinus migraines from strong perfume/chemical smells..

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This Carol’s Daughter Monoi leave-in conditioner works well. I have dry, over-processed, frizzy hair, and it really smoothed out the frizzies and helped to make my hair look tamer and less dry. It did also seem to make it stronger. This is just what I was looking for. Instead of silicones, there are oils in here, such as Tiare Gardenia flower, monoi oil, and Coconut Oil to hydrate and condition the hair. There is also wheat protein and vitamin B5 to strengthen and nourish it. This does not feel greasy or oily. There is no petrolatum, mineral oil, or artificial color. All I do is spray it on my hair when needed, and comb through. I did not notice any scent in this product.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: I absolutely love this leave in conditioner. The scent alone will have you coming back for more. I have dry, damaged, color treated, long hair and this is uhmazing! I spray on when my hair is damp and it keeps everything feeling and looking so much more healthy, especially the ends! My hair is softer and more manageable now. I also spray on when my hair is dry when I feel like I need just a little bit of moisture and to freshen up. This is an amazing product that I will definitely purchase again! Great stuff

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: First unfortunately the bottle leaked during delivery. It was all over the inside of the package. Be careful when you open it. I love the product. It smells great (like gardenia lotion). I love how I can spray it on my hair in the morning and still smell it on there when I go to bed at night. I've been using it for several weeks and my hair seems softer and healthier than when I started with it. I just spray a couple of times after my shower and then massage it in. My hair is not all tangled up and i can run a brush through it easily then. I only use a little bit each time so I'm guessing this will last me a long time. Very happy about that!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: 3.0 out of 5 stars
Review: So, I'm torn about this review.  I LOVE Carol's Daughter products.  I really do.  But it is very hard to determine if this product does all that it claims after just a few uses AND not using it with other brands products.  I love leave-in conditioners.  When I applied this it was like other spray leave-ins.  Easy to apply and moisturized my hair.  As far as the repair and al the other claims, I'm just not sure.  I wouldn't not use it.  It did seem to add moisture to my natural 4-something type hair.  What I liked is that my hair felt moisturized AND I didn't have to have the ENTIRE product line to feel it.  Thank you.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: I received an 8 ounce bottle of Carols daughters, leave in conditioner. The Leave-In Conditioner is supposed to add strength and restore natural moisture to your hair. The product contains a blend of the Tiare Gardenia Flower and Coprah Coconut Oil - plus Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5. Directions -Hold bottle 6-8 inches from hair and spray all over. Use on wet or dry hair to help detangle. Use on dry hair to refresh style. Don't rinse out. The conditioner smells like an overwhelming strong perfume. I am not fond of the smell. The conditioner is also a bit sticky. Overall, it's ok.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: Works great
Review: This is a very good product so far. I've used it repeatedly over the past few weeks and it's been working well as a leave in conditioner. It helps so much with tangles and it leaves my hair with a nice healthy shine. It has so many natural ingredients and none of those damaging ones in so many other products. It seems to be working great and it smells delightful as well. I recommend it if you are looking for a good leave in conditioner that adds a little boost to your hair and makes it look refreshed and renewed.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: This is by far the WORST leave-in conditioner I have EVER used! My hair is fine and I normally don't need a lot of conditioner to make it feel smooth and silky and to detangle so I was shocked when I first sprayed on this conditioner and could feel my hair getting drier and tougher and actually feeling brittle, like hay. The scent is terrible as well. It was so bad that I thought it must be my imagination so I tried again and nope. IT IS AWFUL!  My hair would have felt better using nothing at all! Awful. Just...awful.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: Success depends on the hair cut. Adds body and texture. Smells nice.
Review: This would probably work well with a short layered  boyish hair style because it does add body and texture. My hair is fine, thick, and currently cut in a mid-neck length bob and it needs to be smooth and silky. After shampooing and wrapping my hair in a towel for about ten minutes I applied the product. I was pleased with it at that point because it made my hair easy to comb the tangles out of. But once dry I knew that this leave-in conditioner isn't right for my hair right now. The scent is nice.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I really like Carols daughter products so when I seen a leave in conditioner I was super excited! This product has a light smell not too strong and powerful but it does leave a good scent behind. I washed my hair a few times and sprayed this in afterwards. I was able to run my fingers through my hair better and it didn’t leave a greasy shine behind like some leave in conditioners do. Also great price sometimes these products tend to be expensive so this was a steal.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: I did not like the scent
Review: This leave in conditioner is really nice - and detangles my hair really well. However I think the scent is overwhelming and somewhat old fashion - I am not a big fan of it.The spray is working really well to refresh second day hair. The sprayer is really good too and has a fine mist.The price is good. The only thing I wish that the scent was different or that is was fragrance free. It is hard to describe the scent but I am not liking it.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: Carol's Daughter Monoi Repairing spray does a great job on my teen's hair. She has very curly, coiled and dry hair that is hard to manage. She tries a lot of products and some dry it out further. This conditioning spray makes her hair look and feel softer. The scent is very warm and pleasant and the scent lingers. It's a pleasant experience.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: 2.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I usually love any product by Carol's Daughter, but this one did nothing for my hair.  In fact I found it made my hair a bit stiff so it was harder to untangle my hair.  It was weird.  It left my hands and hair feeling sticky.  I had to apply another leave in conditioner before I was able to untangle my hair.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: not great for fine hair
Review: This is a solid leave-in conditioner that will condition your hair and make it look shiny.  However, it's not great for fine hair like mine because it weighs it down.  Also, I like hair products that smell like herbal essence products.  Although this smells good, it doesn't compare to herbal essence.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: Nice
Review: This is nice, but it didn't do much for my curls. I think it may be more for straight hair. Not sure really. All I know is that my curls did not curl well after using this.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This worked pretty well with the shampoo from the same maker.It’s not a heavy conditioner at all.It basically detangled my hair. It also left it really soft. It has a prominent scent.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Incredible results for naturally textured hair.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: GREAT PRODUCT!!! GREAT SELLER!!!!!!!
Review: FANTASTIC PRODUCT!!! Bought after a friend let me use and fell in love. Smell is amazing very fresh but not overwhelming and makes hair feel incredible!!! Definitely recommend and I received my order 3 days after purchasing.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: it’s not my favorite
Review: not sure if I liked it. it was nice to have a spray on leave in conditioner and just not worry about anything. not sure if it tangled my hair more even after reading the instructions.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: Doesn't moisturize
Review: Does not moisturize AT ALL

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: Leave-In Conditioner
Review: There are 3 products sold and reviewed on this page, this review is for the Leave-in Conditioner. This product works best for me as a hair tamer. I brush my long curly clean hair out, spray on, and then brush through it tames the fly-aways without leaving a stiff hairspray feel. I didn't find the scent at all memorable nor did it detangle my hair (luckily I had rinse out conditioner for that). It did not leave my hair dry or brittle but it didn't make it any softer either.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: Great for hair regimen
Review: All her products are great for healthy hair.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: Report abuse
Review: Super hidratante

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repair and Moisture for Curly Hair Monoi Star Strength Leave In Cream with Monoi Oil for Hydration and Softness, 8.5 fl oz
Title: Left hair dry
Review: Very thin & doesn't have a nice creamy feel when you put it on your hand or hair. You can tell it's an alcohol based product which Is my fault for not reading ingredients. It just dried out my hair, very disappointed & I returned it.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repair and Moisture for Curly Hair Monoi Star Strength Leave In Cream with Monoi Oil for Hydration and Softness, 8.5 fl oz
Title: Great Product
Review: The Monoi line is great. There have been some good natural hair products on the market that just don't remain available over time.I'm so glad the Monoi line from Carol's Daughter has remained on the market.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repair and Moisture for Curly Hair Monoi Star Strength Leave In Cream with Monoi Oil for Hydration and Softness, 8.5 fl oz
Title: Not great on mixed hair
Review: Great scent, though a little strong for my daughter. Unfortunately, this didn't do a great job on my daughter's mixed hair. She said it was sticky and left her hair harder to manage. She said it also did not feel soft or manageable.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repair and Moisture for Curly Hair Monoi Star Strength Leave In Cream with Monoi Oil for Hydration and Softness, 8.5 fl oz
Title: Does what it says it does
Review: Smells good like gardenia and moisturizers my hair! Made my hair softer and added shine back in after dying my hair blonde. It's not a miracle moisturizer but it really does help with dry brittle hair that's damaged from dye! Best product I've come across so far! A little goes a long way with the cream too so no running out in 2 days.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repair and Moisture for Curly Hair Monoi Star Strength Leave In Cream with Monoi Oil for Hydration and Softness, 8.5 fl oz
Title: Can't live without..
Review: I use this daily.  It smells wonderful,  really conditions. I recommend this and all carols daughter products.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repair and Moisture for Curly Hair Monoi Star Strength Leave In Cream with Monoi Oil for Hydration and Softness, 8.5 fl oz
Title: Curly hairs friend
Review: Works beautifully to reduce frizz & soften & moisturize my curly hair.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repair and Moisture for Curly Hair Monoi Star Strength Leave In Cream with Monoi Oil for Hydration and Softness, 8.5 fl oz
Title: This is an amazing product!
Review: This hair cream keeps my natural hair soft despite the Texas summer heat.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repair and Moisture for Curly Hair Monoi Star Strength Leave In Cream with Monoi Oil for Hydration and Softness, 8.5 fl oz
Title: SOFTENS HAIR
Review: MY HAIR FEELS REALLY SOFT

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repair and Moisture for Curly Hair Monoi Star Strength Leave In Cream with Monoi Oil for Hydration and Softness, 8.5 fl oz
Title: Smells sooooo good!
Review: Love the smell. Love the effect. :)

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repair and Moisture for Curly Hair Monoi Star Strength Leave In Cream with Monoi Oil for Hydration and Softness, 8.5 fl oz
Title: Great buy
Review: Great,  love the smell which lasts even on blown dry hair. Help your split ends look better  and your hair feels healthy.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repair and Moisture for Curly Hair Monoi Star Strength Leave In Cream with Monoi Oil for Hydration and Softness, 8.5 fl oz
Title: Miracle cream
Review: This light weight creme is divine and makes my hair super soft and manageable

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repair and Moisture for Curly Hair Monoi Star Strength Leave In Cream with Monoi Oil for Hydration and Softness, 8.5 fl oz
Title: Met expectations
Review: Liked. Met expectations a go to for me

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repair and Moisture for Curly Hair Monoi Star Strength Leave In Cream with Monoi Oil for Hydration and Softness, 8.5 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This leave in conditioner is wonderful. I have long thick curly hair, 2B-3B texture, that stays parched-dry and frizzy. Moisturizing hair products that don’t leave any sticky or slimy residue are far and few in between. Carol’s Daughter got it right with this leave-in cream. It’s kept my hair moisturized and manageable since first applying it on freshly washed hair, 3 days ago. Yes, 3 days ago. I have not needed to reapply it since that first application and needless to say, I’m impressed! My curls still look great, healthy, moisturized. I have not been able to wear my hair down with just using a single product in Lord knows how long. At $22, it’s a little pricey upfront, but for the amount of product you get, and only using as much as your hair needs, this product should last a long time. 10/10 recommended

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repair and Moisture for Curly Hair Monoi Star Strength Leave In Cream with Monoi Oil for Hydration and Softness, 8.5 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I have highly processed bleached hair that is extremely brittle and damaged.  Leave in conditioners are in must for me and I never go without them. I have had experience with many different brands and types and I can say that I am very happy with this one.This one is very creamy and spreads easily through out my hair strands. I don't have to use very much at all to get this to apply throughout my hair. A little dime sized dot is enough for me and I even have thick long hair.  This bottle will last for quite some time before needing to reorder. Good Bang for your buck.I really enjoy how this conditioner smells. It is definitely an in your face and obvious scent and leaves my hair smelling amazing for hours.  I really enjoy it but if you have issues with highly scented products this one might be a little overpowering for you. Something to note ahead of time. I am happy with the level of moisture this adds to my hair. I feel it really does help restore some of the much needed moisture to my hair and it makes it feel softer and smoother. I can get the brush through it much easier without it getting stuck when I apply it to my wet hair. The other thing I like about this leave in conditioner is that it doesn't make my hair look or feel oily at all, compared to some of the other leave in conditioners out there.  It doesn't weigh my hair down at all either.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repair and Moisture for Curly Hair Monoi Star Strength Leave In Cream with Monoi Oil for Hydration and Softness, 8.5 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I have tend to have thin, bleached, and frizzy hair, so I'm always looking for new moisturizing products to use. I also have half curled hair, so I either need to straighten it or scrunch it to make it curly. Initially, I thought this was the deep conditioner for the shower so that's what I used it for the first time. I should have been wearing my glasses, and realized a few days later this was the leave-in conditioner. I was super pleased on using it as a washout! Lol. When I finally used it the right way, it felt really good on my hair. A little goes a long way, and I learned that the first time since I'm used to using a little bit more leave in conditioner products. This brings impressive moisture. Another thing I do with products like this is put a little bit in a spray bottle along with a mixture of other products such as products for frizz or deep conditioning. The majority of it will be distilled water, and I use it after I wash my hair but also as a refresher on most areas except my roots. I am really impressed by this, as leave in conditioners are hard to find that don't leave my hair feeling icky or too dry. I definitely recommend.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repair and Moisture for Curly Hair Monoi Star Strength Leave In Cream with Monoi Oil for Hydration and Softness, 8.5 fl oz
Title: TOP 50 REVIEWER
Review: I first started using the Monoi line from Carol's Daughter when I was transitioning from relaxed hair to natural. It's great to prevent breakage and keep your hair healthy and strong. The scent is so good I wish it were a perfume I could buy. The leave-in is thick and creamy. It leaves your hair soft, moisturized and tangle-free. This definitely needs to be in your hair kit if you want stronger, healthier hair. I HIGHLY recommend it.Thanks so much for taking the time to read this review. I hope the information that I've provided makes your decision a little easier.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repair and Moisture for Curly Hair Monoi Star Strength Leave In Cream with Monoi Oil for Hydration and Softness, 8.5 fl oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I'm not sure how strong it really makes my hair...but it does make it very soft. It smells a little weird to me until it goes in my hair, then it starts to smell pleasant. It's the right consistency to be used as a leave in. A lot of leave ins that I have tried have been too thin, but this one is thick enough that I don't have to worry about dripping it onto the floor.As softening and nice as this is...my hair is absolutely psycho. It still prefers the oil that I make. It's made well though, so I'm not going to ding it just because my weird hair hates it. My hair just doesn't work like normal hair.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repair and Moisture for Curly Hair Monoi Star Strength Leave In Cream with Monoi Oil for Hydration and Softness, 8.5 fl oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: Honest review here.I love this more than I thought.  It is a great moisturizer and detangling conditioner that is light weight and has a nice smell (not too overpowering).  It's also light weight and does not leave a heavy residue on your hair ...which is great.I love that it is free of parabens, has no petroleum and no mineral oils.It's a great leave in conditioner. It leaves my hair hydrated but soft to touch.I love this and will re order.  I use this on my girls too!  They love it too.HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repair and Moisture for Curly Hair Monoi Star Strength Leave In Cream with Monoi Oil for Hydration and Softness, 8.5 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: My hair is pretty dry and brittle and very tangled even after I use conditioner so I decided to give this a try. I love the smell and and the thickness of the product. My hair feels so soft when I use this Monoi repair and moisture and so easy to comb through. I am impressed with how great my hair looks after I  blow dry it, this product does not weigh it down even though Its a leave in conditioner. My hair looks and feels healthier after I apply this, I definitely recommend it!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repair and Moisture for Curly Hair Monoi Star Strength Leave In Cream with Monoi Oil for Hydration and Softness, 8.5 fl oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: The main goal of any hair styling product for me is to reduce frizz while defining curls.  Ideally it's soft, not crunchy, and washes out easily.  This one's almost there.It's a thickish cream in the tube.  I used a small amount rubbed into my hands, then in my hair, evenly distributing from the crown of my hair to the tips.  There's a small amount of frizz remaining (disclaimer: it is a rainy day) and a bit more pouf than I'd like to the body of my hair, but my curls are light and tighter than usual.The scent is a faint coconut, not overpowering.  I needed to wash my hands twice to remove the residue of the styling product, which is a slight annoyance.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repair and Moisture for Curly Hair Monoi Star Strength Leave In Cream with Monoi Oil for Hydration and Softness, 8.5 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This leave-in conditioner is one of the best smelling hair products I have ever smelled I swear. My hair smelled so great after using it. It also made my hair very smooth. I have curly hair that I usually blow dry straight so I need a leave-in conditioner to first detangle my curls after my shower, and this did the job. It didn't weigh my hair down which some leave-in conditioners can do. It wasn't greasy or too light. I'm very pleased with this product and like I said: smells like heaven!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repair and Moisture for Curly Hair Monoi Star Strength Leave In Cream with Monoi Oil for Hydration and Softness, 8.5 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: SO I usually use a number of items to detangle my hair after I wash it because it's become dry and unruly lately. This was a GodSend. It can be applied right along with a spray detangler prior to blow dry. A little goes a long way. When I finish blow drying, my hair feels super smooth and soft. It doesn't have a build up or residue left and it is still bouncy and voluminous. It doesn't weigh my hair down or feel weird like product is in my hair. It'll definitely transform your hair if it's dry. I can't wait to get some more of this because it's a part of my blow dry routine now.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repair and Moisture for Curly Hair Monoi Star Strength Leave In Cream with Monoi Oil for Hydration and Softness, 8.5 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I'm multi-ethnic, so I have thick, coarse hair that tends to have a mind of its own, so I go through a lot of conditioner rather quickly.  This one is thick but not too thick, makes my hair feel very soft and light, not weighed-down, and it smells heavenly - lightly floral with lots of coconut, and I'm from Hawai'i, so to me it smells like home.  I've used several other items from this brand and never been disappointed, so I have no problem recommending it to others.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repair and Moisture for Curly Hair Monoi Star Strength Leave In Cream with Monoi Oil for Hydration and Softness, 8.5 fl oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I think this is a great product for curl definition, as there seems to be a bit of texturizer in it that I can feel harden once it dries.  So I would recommend it for those with wavy or curly hair that needs to be defined. I does leave my hair soft but I do wish there was a bit more hydration, my parched curls need a ton of hydration and this wasn’t quite there for me personally. The smell is very nice, like coconut and vanilla, and the tube has a tonnn of product in it so it will last a really long time.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repair and Moisture for Curly Hair Monoi Star Strength Leave In Cream with Monoi Oil for Hydration and Softness, 8.5 fl oz
Title: Great leave in conditioner
Review: This leave in conditioner smells HEAVENLY! A mix of coconut and flowers. It is a thinner consistency so it works well for even finer hair types like myself. I have used the monoi shampoo and conditioner for year and it has never disappointed. I absolutely love the way this cream makes my hair feel. I tend to get very dry ends during the winter and this has helped my hair gain back it's luster and softness. Overall, highly highly recommended! Would definitely buy this again.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repair and Moisture for Curly Hair Monoi Star Strength Leave In Cream with Monoi Oil for Hydration and Softness, 8.5 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I have tried plenty of Leave In Cream Repair and Moisture, masks, but this is the first time I noticed an immediate change from first use. I used to see so much hair in comb now there is virtually none. I love this stuff one of my favorites. It gives my hair so much moisture. I love how thick the consistency is and the smell is awesome. Its an awesome finishing touch after the conditioner. My hair felt great and moisturized even after the blow dry.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repair and Moisture for Curly Hair Monoi Star Strength Leave In Cream with Monoi Oil for Hydration and Softness, 8.5 fl oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: This smells amazing and works so well on my natural hair. I used it after shampooing and conditioning my hair. I sectioned my hair and applied a quarter sizes amount  to each section. It provided great moisture to my curls without making my hair weighed down or oily. It also keep my hair feeling soft.  Highly recommend.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repair and Moisture for Curly Hair Monoi Star Strength Leave In Cream with Monoi Oil for Hydration and Softness, 8.5 fl oz
Title: I Feel Softness But Little Moisturization
Review: I like using leave-in conditioners—they add moisture/texture to my dry hair and help control wave and frizz.  Unfortunately, this one doesn’t seem to add moisture; instead it makes my hair feel too soft.  And that makes it more difficult to style.  The end result is soft hair (almost fly-away), little body and hardly any control.  I’ll stick with leave-in conditioners that give me better texture.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repair and Moisture for Curly Hair Monoi Star Strength Leave In Cream with Monoi Oil for Hydration and Softness, 8.5 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I love this leave-in cream. I use this on my hair and daughters. I have bleach blonde hair and my daughter have mixed textured hair. This works perfectly for both of us. Monoi restores moisture, helps detangle and makes hair stronger. The scent is pleasant. When I apply this cream I focus on the ends of our hair. If applied all over our roots look oily.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repair and Moisture for Curly Hair Monoi Star Strength Leave In Cream with Monoi Oil for Hydration and Softness, 8.5 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Smells amazing! My daughter is mixed and has very coily curls. This stuff is so hydrating and helps hold the definition in humidity and adds shine. I like that it's in a squeeze bottle...I also like the pump bottles but with this type it makes it easier to use every little bit when you're running out lol. This is one of our favorite products to use!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repair and Moisture for Curly Hair Monoi Star Strength Leave In Cream with Monoi Oil for Hydration and Softness, 8.5 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: What a delicately and fragrantly wonderful leave-in product. I have super thick hair and this help repair the ends that get damaged from high heat tools. I use the hair dryer and curling iron. Great product!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repair and Moisture for Curly Hair Monoi Star Strength Leave In Cream with Monoi Oil for Hydration and Softness, 8.5 fl oz
Title: Great hair product
Review: This hair product works well on my curls.  It has a nice fragrance and leaves my curls soft and bouncy.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repair and Moisture for Curly Hair Monoi Star Strength Leave In Cream with Monoi Oil for Hydration and Softness, 8.5 fl oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I have naturally wavy/curly (2C/3A) hair that I typically heat-style. However, I've been trying to give it a break from heat during the lockdown to help with damage; this means learning to work with my curls rather than fighting them. Since my hair is fine, many curl creams weigh it down and make it look greasy and lifeless. This is a nice compromise between those creams that are too heavy and goopy, and those that are too light and lack moisture/frizz control. The formula is really creamy and leaves my hair very soft and hydrated (very soft--it won't hold a braid with this stuff in it). My curls don't shrink as badly as they do when I just use a leave-in, and I like the scent; it also helps with frizz (at least this time of year--summer would be the real test). My only issue with it is that it doesn't seem to work very well on day 2 after washing; when I woke up, my hair was tangled and difficult to detangle (not unusual for my fine, tangle-prone hair, but some products do last into day 2). I used some detangling spray and it was fine, but typically I'm able to get a couple of days of smooth hair when using a product like this, but this one seemed to all absorb by the end of day 1. I did try adding a bit more to my ends only, and that helped, but then they stuck together a bit. I believe this is a good moisturizer and it works well on my waves, but the curlier parts of my hair needed more moisture the second day. On a positive note, my roots weren't greasy or goopy and my hair wasn't flat or greasy looking; I could easily run my fingers through it after air-drying, which is not all that common for me. I've only used one other product (a Bumble and Bumble product) that works this well after air-drying, but I would consider it slightly better because the results last until my next wash (day 3), so I would give it 5 stars and this 4 stars. This one is a lot less expensive, though, and you get a large amount, so that is a definite factor in this product's favor. It may work better if I added a styling product, but it's pretty nice on its own for at least the first day. As far as strength goes, I haven't noticed less breakage when using this (nor more...just the same).I would recommend this for moisture and some control of dry, wavy/somewhat curly hair, but if you have really curly hair, you may need something thicker/more potent, or an added styling aid.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repair and Moisture for Curly Hair Monoi Star Strength Leave In Cream with Monoi Oil for Hydration and Softness, 8.5 fl oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I received this product through the Amazon Vine program in exchange for an honest review.This is a good leave-in conditioner!The smell is very sweet. I have moderately long, thick hair and struggle to find products to help manage it. I like that this leave-in conditioner didn't leave my hair feeling weighed down or greasy. It made my curls soft and fairly easy to comb.The smell is a little much for me and it is a bit thick to apply, but overall gets the job done.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repair and Moisture for Curly Hair Monoi Star Strength Leave In Cream with Monoi Oil for Hydration and Softness, 8.5 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This leave in cream is a good consistency and absorbs well on freshly washed hair. There's a light scent that doesn't stand out and fades quickly. It is not a greasy product. I suggest some oil afterwards to seal in the moisture.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repair and Moisture for Curly Hair Monoi Star Strength Leave In Cream with Monoi Oil for Hydration and Softness, 8.5 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This smells like an island paradise! My hair drinks this up even after washing with a deep conditioner. It helps hydrate my curls and bring them to life. My hair feels so soft and smells so nice for days after using this.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repair and Moisture for Curly Hair Monoi Star Strength Leave In Cream with Monoi Oil for Hydration and Softness, 8.5 fl oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I use this for my daughters hair because she has curly/wavy hair. Other products seem to really weigh down her curls and make them turn to waves. This really brought a spring back into her curls.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repair and Moisture for Curly Hair Monoi Star Strength Leave In Cream with Monoi Oil for Hydration and Softness, 8.5 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I use this on my toddler’s thick, wavy hair. It makes her hair incredibly smooth and hydrated. It smells like the islands. Love it!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repair and Moisture for Curly Hair Monoi Star Strength Leave In Cream with Monoi Oil for Hydration and Softness, 8.5 fl oz
Title: Works until my hair frizzes again
Review: I have thick curly/wavy hair and works on my hair for a bit but then I have to reapply to tame the frizz. I wish it lasted longer

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Multi Styling Milk, Lightweight Protective Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil for Dry, Damaged and Breakage Prone Hair To Repair and Protect as You Style, 6.8 fl oz
Title: works for my hair
Review: This product smells nice (not too strong), and works to make my hair more curly, and hold the curl for a while. From reading other product reviews, I understand that not every product works for every head of hair.Another favorable feature of this product that I really appreciate is its spray mechanism with a LOCK, which is great for travel and avoiding spills.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Multi Styling Milk, Lightweight Protective Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil for Dry, Damaged and Breakage Prone Hair To Repair and Protect as You Style, 6.8 fl oz
Title: Works great if you don’t mind the smell
Review: Works great for detangling but the smell is off-putting. I keep using it because it works so well. Would be perfect if they could work on the smell.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Multi Styling Milk, Lightweight Protective Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil for Dry, Damaged and Breakage Prone Hair To Repair and Protect as You Style, 6.8 fl oz
Title: Child had a reaction
Review: My child who has an allergy to peanuts, had a skin reaction to this product. While I couldn't find an ingredient that was related to peanuts, parents with children that have an allergy, might want to choose a different product.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Multi Styling Milk, Lightweight Protective Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil for Dry, Damaged and Breakage Prone Hair To Repair and Protect as You Style, 6.8 fl oz
Title: a good product
Review:
The media could not be loaded.
                




   Smells good feels good and my hair feel alive

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Multi Styling Milk, Lightweight Protective Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil for Dry, Damaged and Breakage Prone Hair To Repair and Protect as You Style, 6.8 fl oz
Title: DRIES OUT HAIR!!
Review: There is so much alcohol in this product! It completely dries out my hair worse than normal. One of the worst products I've tried

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Multi Styling Milk, Lightweight Protective Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil for Dry, Damaged and Breakage Prone Hair To Repair and Protect as You Style, 6.8 fl oz
Title: Love this product
Review: Smells great and works super on my dry curly hair

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Multi Styling Milk, Lightweight Protective Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil for Dry, Damaged and Breakage Prone Hair To Repair and Protect as You Style, 6.8 fl oz
Title: Great
Review: Love the scent.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Multi Styling Milk, Lightweight Protective Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil for Dry, Damaged and Breakage Prone Hair To Repair and Protect as You Style, 6.8 fl oz
Title: Lovely Locks
Review: Love the scent. Perfect product to refresh my wavy hair.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Multi Styling Milk, Lightweight Protective Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil for Dry, Damaged and Breakage Prone Hair To Repair and Protect as You Style, 6.8 fl oz
Title: Scent
Review: Great

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Multi Styling Milk, Lightweight Protective Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil for Dry, Damaged and Breakage Prone Hair To Repair and Protect as You Style, 6.8 fl oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: I very much dislike the fragrance of this product but that doesn’t mean that you won’t like it. It smells like white flowers. You can smell the tiare and gardenia quite strongly. It smells like kind of a heavy white flower fragrance to me. Reminds me of BB&W velvet tuberose fragrance. The smell dissipates a bit after drying but it stays pretty strong. I have not used it to heat style yet as I do that very rarely. It is not CG friendly so in combination with the fact that I don’t like the smell, I will drop it from my rotation. It has 3 different dimethicones and a drying alcohol in it. It left my curls a little weighed down but it looked pretty shiny. As a leave in, it dried a little hard but it was able to be scrunched without any flaking or anything.Please hit the button if this info was helpful.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Multi Styling Milk, Lightweight Protective Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil for Dry, Damaged and Breakage Prone Hair To Repair and Protect as You Style, 6.8 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I use this every time I run the straightener or curler through my hair. I have long, fine hair and it's so lifeless that styling is about the only thing I can do to bring the va-va-voom to it. Unfortunately, as a brunette, any time I have damage it shows up on the ends of my hair quite noticeably because of my hair color and the splits.This seems to be working well. I suspect it's the coconut oil in it. It's listed high up on the ingredient list, and it feels soft and silky in my hair. I mist my hair every time I get ready to use a styling tool, but I have also been using this as a general leave in conditioner since the coconut oil makes my hair feel so much nicer when I brush it through my hair. It seems like it gives me a little shine, too.The scent of this reminded me a salon, particularly the purple shimmering lights shampoo. It is a pleasant scent, and doesn't smell heavy like vanilla and lavenders often do. The ingredient list is what I'd call typical. It does have alcohol, but moderation is really key with any hair product.I have noticed less end breakage, and my hair just looks better when using this for styling. It seems like it gives it a little more gloss so it isn't as dry looking. It's also been working nicely for daily use as a moisture provider. I just mist the last couple inches of my hair and brush through. Easy peasy. I'd get this again. The price is comparable to other salon leave-ins.The spritzer on this is excellent. When I opened the bottom, I was worried it was too thick, but it mists wonderfully. The locking mechanism is super simple to use. It has a button to push side to side that visibly says if it's locked or unlocked. It's friendly to use. It's also worth noting this does have petroleum in it, mineral oil, parabens, or any artificial color that may deposit. Coconut oil is ingredient number two, after water so the majority of the product is nourishing oils.Cons: It isn't an issue for me, however consumers should know it has linalool in it and that's likely where most of the scent comes from. Just worth noting if that's an issue for you or you have sensitivity to some smells.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Multi Styling Milk, Lightweight Protective Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil for Dry, Damaged and Breakage Prone Hair To Repair and Protect as You Style, 6.8 fl oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: See update at endI haven’t use Carol‘s daughters products in a long time. I was surprised at this leave in conditioner with a spray bottle. It releases a very fine spray of the product. It’s actually works good for my hair. I have very fine 3C curly hair. A lot of times my leave in conditioner weighs down my hair before I can even put the styling product on. The picture is from a wash day and it immediately has more body to it while drying then when I use my regular leave in conditioner. I’m sure my hair will keep growing in body the dryer it gets. The fine mist  also will be better when I use it to touch up the dry ends in the days following the wash day.UPDATE: My hair did not keep getting fluffier day after my wash day. Even just the little bit of spray that I used seemed to weigh down my baby fine hair. The next day it starts clumping together which it only does when there’s too much oil product in it. This is the only change in my routine that I’ve made. I didn’t think that I used a lot of the spray. Only two or three squirts on my hair before my mousse product. I don’t think that this is a good fit for my hair. I think I’ll stick with their other products.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Multi Styling Milk, Lightweight Protective Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil for Dry, Damaged and Breakage Prone Hair To Repair and Protect as You Style, 6.8 fl oz
Title: 1.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I normally love the Carol’s Daughter brand, but I was very disappointed with this heat protectant repair “styling milk”. Firstly, it came with the cap trigger on backwards. I had to disassemble abs figure out how to get in on correctly. I assumed this was to stop it from spray leaking in transport, but the spray had a lock so this didn’t make sense. I eventually got the sprayer on correctly, and it BROKE the first time I used it. I was able to figure out how to pump some out and the first thing I noticed was the AWFUL SCENT. It smelled like old lady perfume and gave me an awful headache. Thankfully the smell dissipated, but the spray did nothing for my hair. My hair felt frizzy and unconditioned all day. Very disappointed..

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Multi Styling Milk, Lightweight Protective Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil for Dry, Damaged and Breakage Prone Hair To Repair and Protect as You Style, 6.8 fl oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: I’ll be honest: I was disappointed in this product. I’ve heard wonderful things about Carol’s Daughter for curly hair, so I was stoked to try this. But I couldn’t find much I loved about it, unfortunately.As a leave-in conditioner and reparative treatment for curly haired days, it was just OK. First, I tried it by itself, to see what, if anything, it would do to help define curls while it provided whatever conditioning power it was going to. Didn’t do much except weigh my hair down.Next, I tried it as a heat protectant when I straightened my hair. Even less impressed. I actually ended up adding an additional protectant product halfway through running my straightening iron over my hair because I felt like it wasn’t doing enough to protect it. And my ends still looked dry afterward.Maybe I’m just missing something, but this product didn’t live up to the brand’s hype. At least not for me. Very disappointed.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Multi Styling Milk, Lightweight Protective Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil for Dry, Damaged and Breakage Prone Hair To Repair and Protect as You Style, 6.8 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I’ve always wanted to try Carol’s Daughter, but being a stay at home mom, it’s always been out of my price range. So when I saw this product available on Amazon, I jumped to try it. So glad I did. This leave in conditioner is amazing.It’s a thin consistency spray on conditioner that makes it easy to get good coverage over the length of my hair. The fragrance is my favorite part. I literally can smell it all day, even when I have a scarf over my hair.Using this as a leave-in conditioner, my hair afterwards feels silky, soft and hydrated. Using it as a pre-heat treatment, it leaves my hair smooth and frizz-free. You know how some products leave behind a film on your hair that you can feel every time you touch your hair? Yeah, that doesn’t happen here. My hair feels like my hair, just much MUCH healthier. Super satisfied with how well this leave in conditioner has been working for me. I’m going to have to make room in our budget for it. A+++++++ product!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Multi Styling Milk, Lightweight Protective Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil for Dry, Damaged and Breakage Prone Hair To Repair and Protect as You Style, 6.8 fl oz
Title: Excellent Leave-In Conditioner For Dry Hair
Review: I’m always on the lookout for quality leave-in conditioners, but particularly for ones that moisturize dry middle-aged hair like mine.  This monoi milk formula is wonderful—it’s lightweight but leaves hair hydrated and natural looking.  I keep my hair short and textured—lots of layers that accentuate wavy hair.  This spray form is easy to use and smells great.  End results are soft, manageable hair that feels like it did when I was a younger woman.  For added shine and smoothness, I often include Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength 7 Oil Blend after drying my hair.  It’s a great combination that may not work well for oily heads of hair, but totally rejuvenates my dry strands.  This formula has a strong scent of tiare flowers, Tahitian gardenias and coprah coconut oil, and it lingers after styling.  I especially like the spray cap's unique built-in lock system--makes this bottle perfect for travel.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Multi Styling Milk, Lightweight Protective Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil for Dry, Damaged and Breakage Prone Hair To Repair and Protect as You Style, 6.8 fl oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I like this stuff. I used it when my hair was natural and found that it made a big difference in combing it out. It has some slip to it but a good amount of emollient ingredients as well so it's nourishing. I also used it in combing ou my relaxed hair and found that it helps with detangling. There are times that I would apply it before blow drying with a hand dryer and found that it doesn't cause a buildup or residue, which is a plus when you're trying to achieve bounce in your hair. I will say that it's one of those things where a little goes a long way so you don't really need a lot to accomplish the goal. I think it's really versatile in terms of when you can use it so I would say it's really nice to have on hand. It's in a spray bottle but comes out fairly well for a thick creamy substance. The scent is nice but not powerful or overbearing. It's worth the money.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Multi Styling Milk, Lightweight Protective Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil for Dry, Damaged and Breakage Prone Hair To Repair and Protect as You Style, 6.8 fl oz
Title: Detangles myhair and makes it more manageable, slight spraynet smell
Review: I've only this once so far and my first impressions are that it made my hair more manageable and tangle free. I sprayed some on my hand and rubbed it all over my wet hair after showering. In my opinion the scent was similar to spray-net but it didn't remain and wasn't overpowering. I like the bottle and the spray dispenser. As I was rushing to work that was all I could use it for. I'm very excited to try it again in the weekend and use it as a heat protectant and see how my hair will fare. I'll definitely update my review once I try this multi-styling milk. But so far, yeah as a leave in treatment I'm pretty happy with it. BTW my hair is thick, chemically colored black and kinda damaged (from years of japanese straightening but I've stopped that more than 2 years now)

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Multi Styling Milk, Lightweight Protective Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil for Dry, Damaged and Breakage Prone Hair To Repair and Protect as You Style, 6.8 fl oz
Title: Too heavy for my hair and the sprayer broke!
Review: With curly hair, I am always trying everything I can to keep it hydrated and the frizz down so I was looking forward to trying this. Unfortunately, after several uses, it just left me a little blah about it.While the scent was nice and subtle it only seemed to offer minimal extra conditioning for my hair. In addition, I have thin hair and this was just too heavy for it and weighed down my curls which is not what I'm looking for. The final straw was the sprayer broke which leaves no good option to use the rest of the product!I've gone back to what I usually use and my hair is much happier now. Maybe this would work better for someone with thicker hair.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Multi Styling Milk, Lightweight Protective Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil for Dry, Damaged and Breakage Prone Hair To Repair and Protect as You Style, 6.8 fl oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I quite like this leave in conditioner. The light coconut scent is very pleasant, and as it goes on in a fairly fine mist it doesn’t weigh my hair down. I haven’t been using it long enough to know if it has a noticeable strengthening effect, and unfortunately I’m not sure I’ll keep using it regularly enough to learn. Despite the good points this leaves my hair (which is fairly short, as I’m a guy) feeling just a little greasy, and that’s a dealbreaker for me. Even slightly greasy hair hits me like nails down a blackboard, so I can’t see myself using this very much.I’m giving it 4 stars, though, because apart from the residue it looks and smells like a really good product.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Multi Styling Milk, Lightweight Protective Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil for Dry, Damaged and Breakage Prone Hair To Repair and Protect as You Style, 6.8 fl oz
Title: Can never go wrong with Carol's Daughter
Review: This is a 2fer! A heat protectant and a leave in conditioner all in one - 2fer 1 😆 I'm a fan of Carol's Daughter products. They work wonders in my kids hair (I'm white, their dad is AA, and their hair is all over the place). This one I have been using as a leave in for my daughter. The thing with every Carol's Daughter product I've ever tried is they leave my kids curls looking boing-a-liscious while also making them look soft and healthy (instead of wet and hard as some products do). It's a spray, so I get lots of coverage and get to use less product to do so. This is a wonderful product for curly haired people and people with a little bit of everything going on up top. Carol's Daughter for the win again!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Multi Styling Milk, Lightweight Protective Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil for Dry, Damaged and Breakage Prone Hair To Repair and Protect as You Style, 6.8 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: My daughter is mixed (black/white) and her hair is loving this. She can use only this and it holds her coils and makes them look hydrated and healthy. It also does the same if she’s wearing her hair in a pouf, looks really nice. My wife, who is white-- I mention that just because her hair texture is different than our daughter’s and not all products that work for our daughter work out for her hair-- she loves to put it in her ends after styling since her ends are usually really dry and says it's very moisturizing. They both are liking it a lot and say that it smells amazing. The bottle is a good size, nozzle works good and has a lock for the sprayer that also works good.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Multi Styling Milk, Lightweight Protective Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil for Dry, Damaged and Breakage Prone Hair To Repair and Protect as You Style, 6.8 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I love the smell of this styling milk. It lingers for a little while after you use it. I used it for a protective style and my hair smelled wonderful. It mists a little too wide for me but I just ended up spraying it closer to the section of hair I was working with. It definitely helped with detangling and I think made my curls a little tighter. It made my hair a little softer and easier to manage which is always a good thing. Adding to my wash day regimen.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Multi Styling Milk, Lightweight Protective Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil for Dry, Damaged and Breakage Prone Hair To Repair and Protect as You Style, 6.8 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I don't use hair products that contain oil on the crown area of my head. They just end up weighing down my hair too much. But I do like to use them on the areas away from my scalp, especially the ends. This protecting spray smells very nice. It reminds me of the beach. It must be the coconut oil scent. Anyway, I really like it. It adds a nice softness to my hair, making it much more manageable without making it limp. I like that it offers protection against all the heated styling tools I use as well. It is a nice size bottle at almost 7 ounces with a easy to use trigger spray nozzle. This has become my new favorite!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Multi Styling Milk, Lightweight Protective Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil for Dry, Damaged and Breakage Prone Hair To Repair and Protect as You Style, 6.8 fl oz
Title: Magical
Review: My hair is soft and healthy all the time, but switching out my usual heat protectant has been life changing. Aside from smelling amazing, I can’t get over how well this works and how smooth and soft it makes my hair. I not only recommend this product, but I will be using this product from now on.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Multi Styling Milk, Lightweight Protective Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil for Dry, Damaged and Breakage Prone Hair To Repair and Protect as You Style, 6.8 fl oz
Title: Nice light protection
Review: I've been wanting a heat defense styling spray because its a lot easier to evenly distribute in my hair. The scent of this spray is more perfumey than I'd like but I don't notice it much once my hair is styled. I liberally spray this through my ends before I blow dry my hair and it doesn't weight down my hair at all. I haven't been using it long enough to see how much it protects my hair, but I can notice that it helps with frizz and humidity after i blow dry.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Multi Styling Milk, Lightweight Protective Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil for Dry, Damaged and Breakage Prone Hair To Repair and Protect as You Style, 6.8 fl oz
Title: Works pretty decent for natural curls and straightening
Review: This has worked really well for wearing both natural and straightening my hair. It doesn’t weigh my hair down, feel sticky or crunchy. Like others have mentioned, it does have a strong smell, it fades away after a while. I don’t think it’s amazing, but sometimes it just takes finding the right combo of products, so it may have great potential after more use, overall is pretty good.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Multi Styling Milk, Lightweight Protective Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil for Dry, Damaged and Breakage Prone Hair To Repair and Protect as You Style, 6.8 fl oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: I really like that the first and second ingredients are simply water and coconut oil without an alcohol taking one of those spots. This is a high quality, protective milk that is great for nourishing hair. I also like that it comes in a convenient spray bottle which makes application and styling much easier.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Multi Styling Milk, Lightweight Protective Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil for Dry, Damaged and Breakage Prone Hair To Repair and Protect as You Style, 6.8 fl oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: what i like about the product:- smells great- easy to spray- leaves hair smelling great and feeling moisturized- lightweight and has a detangling affect- free of parabens- protects hair from heat and split endsdown side:- spray is a very fine mist and could waste alot of product if you dont spray close to your hair

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Multi Styling Milk, Lightweight Protective Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil for Dry, Damaged and Breakage Prone Hair To Repair and Protect as You Style, 6.8 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This stuff smells so good and really helps keep my hair soft and managable. It lasts so long and I use it on my daughters hair too! Highly recommend

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Multi Styling Milk, Lightweight Protective Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil for Dry, Damaged and Breakage Prone Hair To Repair and Protect as You Style, 6.8 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: The scent, i don't gravitate towards but I can tolerate. Helps me protect my hair from heat damage and does not feel like its weighed down a lot. Would recommed.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Multi Styling Milk, Lightweight Protective Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil for Dry, Damaged and Breakage Prone Hair To Repair and Protect as You Style, 6.8 fl oz
Title: N/a
Review: N/a

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Multi Styling Milk, Lightweight Protective Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil for Dry, Damaged and Breakage Prone Hair To Repair and Protect as You Style, 6.8 fl oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Pros:1. Nice sprayer.2. Adds moisture which makes it easier to get the tangles out.3. Gives my waves and curls more definition.4. Provides heat protection.Cons:1. I do not like the smell and it does linger for a while.2. Does not tame my frizz. (Not many products do.)Overall, I like Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repair and Protect Multi-Styling Milk and would order the product again.Disclosure of Material Connection: I received this product via the Amazon Vine program. All opinions in this review are my own.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Multi Styling Milk, Lightweight Protective Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil for Dry, Damaged and Breakage Prone Hair To Repair and Protect as You Style, 6.8 fl oz
Title: 1.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I used to love Carol's Daughter but wow has this brand completely fallen off and away from its initial target audience and their hair types... The milk was thin and watery and had a sticky feel to it. After using it left this sticky film on my hair that made it feel horrible. The monoi smell is wonderful but this product is terrible.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Multi Styling Milk, Lightweight Protective Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil for Dry, Damaged and Breakage Prone Hair To Repair and Protect as You Style, 6.8 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Styling protectant is something I've been seriously missing in my haircare regimen. I don't style my hair all too often BUT i really love my  blow dryer device from Drybar and I realized that it gets REALLY hot. I like this spray and how the nozzle is designed with the built in safety so it doesn't leak when you travel with it. This works into my hair easily and without weighing it down. Time will only tell if its doing a good job protecting my hair :)

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Multi Styling Milk, Lightweight Protective Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil for Dry, Damaged and Breakage Prone Hair To Repair and Protect as You Style, 6.8 fl oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I have thick, curly hair that's on the coarse side. I like this leave in a lot, but I feel like my hair needs a little *more*. It's very thin and sprays in a fine mist. The scent in very strong, so if you like it, which I do, you will enjoy using this product. I didn't notice the scent lingering for a long time, so unless you absolutely hate it, you'll also probably be fine.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Multi Styling Milk, Lightweight Protective Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil for Dry, Damaged and Breakage Prone Hair To Repair and Protect as You Style, 6.8 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This smells amazing! The spray goes on easily, make sure you use it on wet hair. I forgot this last time I washed my hair and put it on dry and it was too much. It helps moisturize and bring the curl back to my hair. My hair feels and looks so nice when I use this spray.
